KWxHM_DxUsdmilL0pxqQZQ.text: Fantastic, authentic Middle East deli in Charlotte.    Food is fantastic, prices are unbelievably low and the owner makes you feel like family.  Seating is limited due to the deli style.  I usually call ahead for take out.

wARTIKw-x9s_N7ghII4mPA.text: First time here and this place is pretty good. The prices on food is reasonable.  The lentil soup is delicious, and lamb kabob was cooked right.

photos.caption: Photo of La Shish Kabob - Charlotte, NC, United States. This lentil soup is delicious. Cook well.

vyK78f6w7DgVUHeHNwUWSw.text: We went to the buffet and it was just ok but out of a lot of hot things that weren't replenished. They microwaved our kunefe which ruined it! No one wants microwaved kunefe, it's soggy and the cheese becomes congealed and too chewy. Why would you microwave kunefe at a restaurant? Give us a warning! :/ The beauty of kunefe is crunchy on top with melty cheese between and drowned in rose water simple syrup.  Nothing is better than putting your fork into the first piece and hearing that crunch! What a disappointment to an already lackluster meal.

G-MUs2JuXhHPoSCvFlhVGQ.text: The best middle eastern joint in Charlotte, hands down. They recently remodeled to include more seating inside the restaurant, which much better accommodates the volume of customers. I usually get a wrap and the veggie plate. The chicken shawarma is always cooked perfectly and has wonderful flavor while still being tender. The veggie plate is a HUGE amount of food, which I get to share with at least one other person. The lintel soup is so tasty, and welcome in the cold months. The price is right, especially for the quality and quantity of food and the owner is one of the nicest I've had the pleasure of talking to in Charlotte. If you're not eating here, you're doing it wrong.

g0MeCIOlh16uBbAR-USHig.text: I had fairly high expectations going in, and I'm so glad La Shish Kabob did not disappoint.  I plan to make many future trips to this little place.  My partner and I both had the lamb kabob wrap.  Inside, the lamp was so tender and wonderfully flavored.  I can't quite figure out what the spices are.  The hummus and the veggies inside were delicious.  I also had the falafel - I just loved the flavor, and the texture was perfectly crispy on the outside but soft on the inside.    My decor inside was not much, of course- just a few tables you can sit at.  Very plain decor and limited seating, but it's a good place to get take away.  The prices are very affordable; our wraps were $5 each and we got an 8 count falafel for $4.  All our food was made fresh while we waited.  The staff was quite friendly and helpful.  I'm excited about going back soon.

BSFN439TKN0WNnu7aKtjZA.text: First let me say I love the atmosphere of this place. It feels very homey, and the owner is very welcoming and helpful with recommendations. I give it 3 stars, because the food was good enough, but not amazing. Ordered lamb kabob, lamb gyro with fries,, and baba ganoush. The lamb kabob was full of flavor, and the meat was very tender. Could've used a little more meat in the sandwich, but nothing to complain about. The lamb gyro was good, nothing out of the usual. The fries however that came with it were soggy and undercooked. The best thing was the baba ganoush. They also offer prepared foods and desserts like baklava as well as other Lebanese canned and dry foods.

fwIkv6RVCtoHoknf0bP6eg.text: We have lived in Charlotte for three years and we moved here from Nashville, TN. We have tried several restaurants during restaurant week, La Shish Kabob is our new favorite, hands down! Amazing Sunday dinner Buffet and everyone was very friendly!

xadxO0KXQtKn1R40gkIrjA.text: One of the places that I have to visit every time I come home to Charlotte. Cheap eats and great food. The falafel is my favorite. Got 2 falafel wraps and fries for $8.99. They've expanded since my last time there so it's not as crowded. Haven't found anything in Atlanta that compares to this yet.

MjAwu0UXjyK4Ky-WOXu7sg.text: Extremely authentic. They even bless the meat before killing and cooking it. Awesome food, too. Will definitely come again. Sadly, they don't deliver; if they did, that'd be awesome.

ZCxKnuHDq23WcnZWjOPeWw.text: Wife and I went for a Tuesday lunch.  Had the buffet , not bad. 4 meats, 2 soups, plain and seasoned rice, 3 sauces, hummus, and couple of salads.  A bit pricy for the minimal spread, but the food was good.  Nothing spicy, some needed more spice.  Overall, we will be back, but probably order from the menu.

i6qek7PUPMMmkADnVmCZ3Q.text: La Shish is where it's at for some quick and yummy gyros or hummus, kabobs and just good meat in general. They just recently opened up another side to have more seating (like over double than what was in there before). IT IS NOT FANCY. So don't go in there on your high horse. It's all about speed with them and I appreciate that. Ask them anything if you have questions or don't know what something is. You get huge portions. Just give them your order, go grab a drink from the cooler and pick a table. The owner is really nice, he has a huge family so I am happy to see their success in this spot, it is always busy (hence why the expanded.)  My fave is that bomb hummus with some grilled chicken, delicious!

QgZJ428dm2sh2GdhFeBbLA.text: The owner is so nice!!! The veggie combo is delicious. La shish kabob is my favorite restaurant in my neighborhood.

He order the lamb kabob wrap and I ordered the lamb Philly cheese sub. So far I think it's the best Philly cheese I have had in Charlotte. My husbands kabob was excellent as well.

ciXlSTE64tP17mNpzZj48w.text: This place is affordable and fantastic. I got a huge platter of lamb and rice plus a super fresh salad for $11.99. This was easily enough for two, I'd estimate at least 12 ounces of lamb if not a full lb was on my plate. The lamb was excellent and the rice pilaf was one of the best I have eaten full of saffron and veggies. They also have excellent hummus and baba ganough.   The service was friendly. Took my order and it was done very quickly. The restaurant itself is in an old strip center but clean and nice and bright.   I'll be back!

CMoRjpwgI1lw1fD3KsLgAg.text: I'm visiting NC from Cali. Numerous people told me that I must go to LA shish kabob, that it's the best in town. I went and had dinner there with some friends and boy were they right! It was sooo good! The meats had so much flavor and were sooo juicy! The customer service was excellent! Next time I'm in the area I will make sure I make a stop here!

photos.caption: Photo of La Shish Kabob - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beef shawarma Delicious

ISJJhQBt49zwN21ND7q5MA.text: Talk about authentic! The owners are from Jerusalem, and there's a tiny menu board at the front of the shop, where menu items are spelled out in Arabic in bright chalk.    Prices are super cheap, and you get a lot of food.   There isn't much ambiance here, and that's OK.  It's a small joint in a strip center featuring some ethnic food marts and just down the street are some check-cashing shops. It's an easily overlooked restaurant. There are also no formal menus, just paper fold-out ones.   The falafel here truly is one of the best I've had in Charlotte.  Very crispy and not too herbacious (Kabob Grill is one of my faves, but the falafel can sometimes be too green inside.) The falafel wrap is only $3! It comes with tahini and some slivers of red onion. The 8 pieces for our appetizer were just $3.99.   I got the hommous and shwarma platter with the house salad.  The salad of thinly shredded lettuce, cucumbers, red onion and dressing was a nice pairing to the rich and creamy hommous in olive oil. The dish (photo enclosed) was enormous and $7.99.   BTW: You can buy an entire roast chicken (a-la Costco style) seasoned with their own mix of herbs and spices, for $7.99!  For $24, you can get a 4 piece meal to take home, which features 2 whole chickens!   What I loved was the variety of people who walked through the doors during my lunch.  Police officers, men in business suits, small kids.    Keep in mind, there is no sweet tea/iced tea.  Just canned sodas, some juices and drinks written in Arabic, and waters.    In addition to dessert (which was a pisachio pastry in flaky phyllo, not as sticky and over sweet as baklava...just the right portion size, about the size of a half-dollar coin) they sell meat pastries and buns.   I'm not in this neighborhood often, but when the craving for Middle Eastern strikes, I'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of La Shish Kabob - Charlotte, NC, United States. The chicken shwarma/hummus plate

js5-RCJRJwUPuMWuXpBztw.text: This place used to be great. They expanded and I felt like the quality went down. The dishes became drier and lacking of flavor. -WhNLngYgOcHmY0Sclk6hA.text: This place is the best kind of hole-in-the-wall. As a Middle Easterner in Charlotte, I was thrilled that my friend brought me here. I would love to try some of their Friday specials sometime. I highly recommend the meat pies. I had plenty of food to bring home, and I know I'll be visiting again when I need my fix of Middle Eastern food.

afUQha0g6J13LjDLrvlxyw.text: Had a great meal here with a friend and I will absolutely be back. I loved the hummus - excellent!  The only reason for 4 instead of 5 stars - the music was so loud it was hard to carry on a conversation. Please turn the music down!

I guess the fries were 5 bucks.  Oh my sandwich was just meat nothing like the description he stated it was right.

LAnqdAGR6jfjrNgJZC2mng.text: I love this dirty, small, simple yet delicious place. I lived in Berlin for a while and loved these places. If you are there for quality food and do not mind that the eye will see some greasy cooking and a bit rundown environment than you are in for a treat. This place is as authentic as it can get. Unfortunately, it is not located close to my place, but I think about this place a lot and cannot wait to return. They serve wonderful shwarma sandwiches even with pickles in them, the way I am used to it from the Lebanese places I used to eat at in Berlin. Great prices and many different options. The staff is super friendly. There are not many tables, but it is always possible to get a spot. There are also a few tables outdoor, however, it is not equipped for large groups.  I love this place and will continue to return and highly recommend the food quality and options in terms of Middle Eastern food.

Pubsw9WS1qG5e1YfzBMzLQ.text: Great service, classic Arabic food and atmosphere. Had the chicken shawarma wrap, Greek salad, kafta wrap, and lamb wrap.  All were pretty tasty.   At least I saw fresh being made stuff, I'm not sure if I'm missing it or there really isn't any amazing middle eastern places in general in NC, but so far the best middle eastern place I have tried in NC.   I will be back again to try some different items.

qRLTlLg3wCLtGEYNDnSREQ.text: The owner, the guy behind the counter, has hit it out of the park. I am impressed. The food is a huge portion - plenty for two full size adults. We ordered a plate of lamb Kevin with a side of rice and cucumber salad - it was excellent, we also ordered a side of small hummus, it was huge and turned out to be far too much food for us both. They're open until midnight because they're running their buts off until then. It was 10 pm when we left but people were still coming in the door on a Friday night. I would have provided pictures but the food was too good to waste time with the camera. Very affordable, very comfortable.

kzZF9A_ObgjfIUVk4KD0cA.text: Great Middle Eastern food!!  The gentleman who runs the place has a very warm and gracious spirit.

2klBzAax-KQs3OG1SUl_Dw.text: Been here a couple of times over the last month. The first time, I ordered the mixed kabob platter with chicken kabob, kofta kabob, and shish kabob. mJ0qqE6FAfT8QqID9Ve9eQ.text: My cousin told me about this spot months ago, I feel stupid for taking so long to go. I went with some friends for an early dinner and ordered the chicken shawarma & hommos with my two sides being salad and special rice. While we were waiting on our meals the guy working there gave us a sample of falafel. This was my first experience with falafel and it was AMAZING we actually ordered eight pieces. After knocking out the falafel our. Meals came out with enough food for a small army. I tried my hardest to finish my amazing hommos and rice but had to throw the towel in. Will definitely be back and hoping I can make it there from uptown on lunch!

ojim3HLUztKgRsjJqF43ew.text: DAMN YOU EXPECTATIONS!  After all these raving reviews, I dragged my newly-found-food-loving boyfriend past my usual quickie hole in the wall middle eastern place on Central Ave. to try out this new hole in the wall for an early dinner.  The place looks promising as we walked in: small, nothing fancy, and a table of middle eastern diners... my thought was, SCORE!  With all the options it was hard to make a decision.  But I was determined to try the lentil soup so I ended up getting the half roast chicken with 2 sides, one side being the soup and the other being the special rice ($7.99).  He ordered a falafel sandwich wrap ($2.99) and a chicken chicken shawarma sandwich wrap ($3.99).  Lentil soup was different, almost has a hint of squash taste, plus it's my first non-green lentil soup, but it was otherwise yummy and perfect for an unexpected day of cold weather.  Then the rest of the food arrived.  The 2 sandwich wraps were huge for the price... but disappointingly they had more fillers (tomato/cucumber/etc.) than the meat and the sauce so the taste got washed off a little.  The falafel one was definitely better; it was perfectly crispy fried and well seasoned.  Meanwhile my half chicken and rice looked impressive.  I swear there's enough rice to feed a family of four on the plate.  But as I forked my way into the chicken, it was unbelievably DRY!  I seriously could not even eat the wing because it was bone dry.  The skin looked yummy golden brown but lacked flavor... so if the skin had no flavor, imagine how bland the meat was.  It's so dry that even the dark meat was getting tough, which I didn't even think was possible.  What a let down :(  The only saving grace of my plate was the garlic sauce... it looked like a lump of mayo, but it was garlic-y.  I smeared it all over everything to give my plate some much needed taste.  Since it's my 1st visit, I am not going to write it off yet.  I think next time I'll give their kafta a try.  But my suggestion is to stay away from the chicken.  The only other high point of yesterday's visit was the discovery of a newly open Nile Grocery and Ethiopian Restaraunt sign that was being put up as I was fighting a losing battle with my chicken.

ZDcgyezgZlC_BGxVtiD0aw.text: The food is so amazing. Get the lamb. you'll miss out on something majestic if you don't. And totally don't be discouraged by the location. it's fast, they are incredibly friendly and you'll get two plates worth out of what you order. it was my first time eating middle - eastern food and i will be back without a doubt.

slqCkY373uM4ixFi9tGjkg.text: Ohh my mama. I have to take back charlotte has nothing to offer. Just came from this spot that I had bookmarked for a while. Great food and plenty to eat thrice. The owner I think was very personal despite the streaming customers coming in. This is my spot and I'll be back. Thank you for taking me to a Middle East trip.

Iisb_Zq5gXfIP834HR-4kA.text: got to go!! everything is great. service super friendly. falafel wrap=best $5 sandwich anywhere in town. new extension says it all, business is booming and deservedly so.

dZ-KuGV54XwE6JQwnMHqIQ.text: What the dining area in this tiny strip-mall restaurant lacks in ambiance is made up in spades by the fresh and authentic flavors of the Middle East.  Truly this is a diamond in the rough, worth seeking out for well-known favorites like hommos, tabouli, and falafel.  In many senses, walking into LSK is no different from walking into an American deli.  A couple glass cases hold cold salads and meats.  There is a fryer and grill behind there.  A small case behind the register holds desserts.  Tables are basic and laminated menus are plentiful.    A closer look, though, tells you this is something different.  First off, the meats in the coolers are skewered on what looks like large swords.  Large skewers rotate on the grill over a gas flame.  Cold salads include tabouli, hommos and baba ganoush.  For my first venture in, I made lunch out of an order of falafel and stuffed grape leaves.  I watched as 8 small patties were scooped with a small tool and fried fresh before me.  They came out so hot that I couldn't close the container they were served in.  A quick taste proves what others have said- just the right mix of chewy texture inside with a crisp outside.  Moist and flavorful, these were a home run.  Stuffed grape leaves were perfectly portioned and came with a lemon-like dipping sauce.  These were slightly pungent by themselves, but the lemon sauce punched them up perfectly, like a counter-weight, adding some acid to the mix to balance the flavors.  I'd have some more, please.  Though I skipped it, the hommos looked creamy and fresh, and even the small order seemed enormous on the plates of other diners.  Wraps with shwarma or kafka looked huge and give me something to consider next time.  There are also daily lunch specials the owner, Izzat, will happily show you.  Braised lamb shank looked strong once unveiled, if that's you thing.  Gotta love the mix of regional flavors coming out of East Charlotte right now.  Asian, Latin American, Indian, and Middle Eastern: all are well-represented here.  Now if only it weren't such a trek to go explore.  Luckily, LSK makes it worth the trip.

L0gNhZVmTzepi_XTRkUqtA.text: I love the falafel-it's the best I've had really. The shawarma is really good also. The fries that come with the shawarma are always pretty sub par but I'm not coming for the fries obviously, so it's whatever. Oh and they have this dip that comes with the shawarma-I'm pretty sure it's just garlic and mayonnaise but it is so good! Homemade grape leaves-just tons of really yummy food!

xsLR9cJLHLlggyLc1Us5lA.text: One of my favorite hot spots for Kabobs and Mediterranean food. We tried their lamb shank and  cornish hen and what can I say, everything is delishhh and on point!  Highly recommend this joint!

0D8fauU8rdXUal_O74Glnw.text: Since I moved to Charlotte I have been craving a tasty, dirt cheap falafel sandwich. I had recently caught wind that this neighborhood was blossoming with Middle Eastern choices, and La Shish Kebob was exactly what I had been hoping for. For $3 you get a decent (not generous but also not stingy) serving of falafel surrounded by tomatoes, mint (at least I could have sworn it was mint), tahini, onion, pickled cucumbers and peppers. All of it is wrapped like a burrito in a pita bread. Could it have used a healthy dose of hot sauce (and I don't mean the Texas Pete they had sitting on the table), yes. but it was utterly delicious without.   The restaurant is pretty standard for a strip mall outpost. I stayed to eat but that was just because I didn't trust myself to make it home without digging in. The gentleman behind the counter was helpful and let me know that they didn't have takeout menus in yet but they would on Monday. That's good news because as soon as I got home I was checking to see if I can make it to La Shish Kebob and back on my lunch hour...I can!

J6RZD7iOAyMj31R4Uc_Gxw.text: Very authentic resturant! You could smell the flavors the minute you walked in.. great steak and cheese philly.. they didnt put cheese on mine :(... but I did love the half chicken with rice.. saved my life of hunger ab few times. Happy camper. I cant say that im the biggest fan of trying the diffrent foods they offer but I like to look at them.

UKTFumuU7jVRN2hvKmfPmA.text: It is a little far to me so I can't go every week. Excellent taste for the kebabs...I would do take outs here.

wndh87nySAtesvWyOEyiAg.text: The food is authentic, fresh and delicious. Came all the way from high Point and it was well worth it :)

photos.caption: Photo of La Shish Kabob - Charlotte, NC, United States

Rdh6rwLKa0rAczJIv3QFKA.text: Ok disappointed with the roasted chicken I got the first time because it was dry but the second time around and still disappointed :/ Dry chicken in shwerma! No tomatoes or onions just lettuce and sauce. Nice people but lacking in food quality I think they use the dry rotisserie chicken for the wraps. I hate lazy cooks. If you say you have tomatoes and onions in your wraps then have tomatoes and onions in your wraps! I paid for dry chicken, pita bread and lettuce. Not ok and I ordered several for my family. Will not buy chicken here again but the mansaf is 100%!

vlvR3WRtpfkbZneDI3Hrnw.text: This is one of my favorites.  Great mix of kabobs cooked on the grill to order, schwarma, rice, and salads.  It's not in the greatest area, but what good ethnic restaurant is?  I'll frequently drive 50 miles round trip to get carryout here.  Portions are huge, and even splitting with another person will leave you with leftovers for later.  Love the atmosphere, which reminds me of the real thing in the middle east.  Full of young Arabic families or groups of men picking apart roast chickens with their hands.  Arab TV channels on the telly.  Feels like you're in  Dubai.   Good bread from the Syrian bakery down the street.  Go there for freshest deserts.  Don't overeat, because the food is heavy in lamb fat-- which though delicious-- can be difficult on unfamiliar Western tummies.  Owner very friendly and helpful, as is everyone else who works there.  They really aim to please!

5YUo_Gf92Mf--p94b6HvXA.text: Very good prices. The meat is prepared well. The only complaint is the rice...it's kind of stale and flavorless. Other than that these guys have perfected quick-sit-down Middle Eastern food for Charlotte standards.

47ELDzMiunh2S_aLKdXHew.text: Not impressed by the food, but then again in Dearborn Michigan there's incredible Lebanese food that's hard to beat! It wasn't terrible but I hope to find somewhere better and don't go there for the ambiance.

3_e1eDpoq52dXlYE3Vg7Pw.text: Loved the grilled chicken. And the price of the food is reallly low.  Highly recommend this place.

lmmvq4LPT2uJkUY5Ax5Yog.text: Food was fresh,  fast, and had large portions. The place reminds me of joints I frequented in New York. Will be back. I had the kafta and lentil soup. Both were delicious.

-AQwVaxdfalhIPSRMaub4w.text: Go! Best lamb wrap in town. Tabbouleh is wonderful and they have great specials to boot. Drive across town if you have to, but go!

yeu6npQkTOxGUd1fUmIITg.text: This place is awesome. I was visiting Charlotte in June 2012 and my brother brought us here for dinner. The food was so good that we came back for our last meal here again before flying back to CA.  I would recommend the whole lamb leg or the cheese steak sandwich. Their sheesh kabab was very delicious. The owner was very accommodating to our family

BmEVvs55MyyONC8dZIVCTQ.text: Stopped by this place for lunch last week. My first visit. Not much to look at but I wasn't there for the decor. I ordered a falafel wrap to go. Wow! Great flavors. The wrap was outstanding! The price was nice too, $3.99. I need to go back and try the shawarma. One tip: if you have a job that requires you to talk to the public, the falafel wrap might not be the best choice if you are on a lunch break. Plenty of onions & garlic in this one. I'll be back for another go on my day off!!

u1AvRAQAhkTwIqMd8kHqrw.text: Go there! Get the lamb kabob. Pay the extra buck for the special rice. Ask for all the sauces because they're all amazing. We got the appetizer sampler thing and everything was delicious. The lentil soup is crazy good. You CANNOT go wrong here. Tons of awesome, fresh food at a very reasonable price. Oh, and don't expect atmosphere because there is none but it seems to be mainly a takeout place anyway.

zTSFVxaK8NRcCp15WHX9bw.text: I had been frequenting La shish Kabob. Their lentil soup is homemade perfection, their vegetarian combo a delight, and their pistachio baklava is just amazing.delicious kefta too.

j4-MJfxYeTM2RLv-KvDhqA.text: Love this place!  My son in law chose the buffet and loved everything. I have enjoyed the mixed grill on several occasions. The lamb is SO GOOD. I've also eaten their falafel. Yummy. The last time I ate there I discovered how perfectly seasoned the rice is. My only complaint is that the salad of tomato and cucumber was too salty.

1JRMx5RQ36XmpPnFuCMEFg.text: Just WOW. The food here is amazing. Great flavors and great customer service. The owner is always there! Definitely gotta try the kebbebs, and kabbobs, the chicken is also really good. They also do caterings for big events.

j7xKIHL2sUaSs5x8En3qRA.text: I came here after seeing some rave reviews on Yelp. I ordered over the phone for pick up. The owner said it would be ready in 10 minutes and it sure was. I had the appetizer combo with hummus, falafel, and grape leaves. I had a side order of pita. The portions were generous. I really enjoyed my order and I would like to try the shawarma and kebabs next time I visit this establishment. The restaurant itself, is nothing fancy. It's good to note that they have had 100% sanitation rating the last three years. The owner is very kind! The prices are great.

photos.caption: Photo of La Shish Kabob - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hummus , Falafel, and grape leaves appetizer combo

8MIlxlMXJDEY54efMYqp6Q.text: Went in to try something new. Got the ground beef wrap per suggestion. Noticed the buffet was set up..I was told it was so popular during Ramadan that it's offered everyday now! $14.95 from 1pm-10pm. Yay!!! I will be back for that.

hN_3rusaVulKQKgwQYJvNQ.text: This is so much better than any of the the greek/middle eastern chains out there so skip then and head here.  I love their Vegetarian Combo it has everything you would want on it.  I have never been there for their buffet which is on my list.  They are great for take out and the portions are very large.  Most orders come with bread and ask for extra garlic butter because it is great.  The owner is also super nice and if your order is ever wrong he makes sure to make up for it.

t88GkMl6QaDHptMM4iaHfQ.text: Oooooo this place was so good. The owner was so nice and very friendly.   Order the Lamb  Philly with the Falafel wrap. My 1st time and I am ready to come back. Excited to tell my friends

JVX98hRKJEYnROP7v-Xwjw.text: So darn good. I get the lamb shanks every time. Huge pieces of meat dripping off the bone. They just expanded the restaurant so now there's a lot more room for dining.

E-N-BHt2Ykkit3-r9RMVbw.text: Love the NY style shawarma!  Owner is so inviting and welcoming, and the food is fantastic.  The lentil soup is amazing with the garlic mayo.  I've had many a shawarma and this dish was divine.  If I lived in Charlotte I would ve getting take out from here weekly.

HDKMRtKzY1Fx0g611ccfeQ.text: Oh, how I love la shish! I have only ever had the chicken shawarma and haven't tried anything else because it is awesome. For $7.99, you get two small wraps and fries. I don't really eat the fries but that's because the wraps are sooooo yummy. The chicken is so flavorful and the Arabic pita bread is delicious. There is a garlic sauce on the side that is potent and amazing!    My boyfriend likes their cheese steak so for those who don't want authentic middle eastern, they got something for you! He also normally eats one of my chicken shawarma wraps and likes it. #chickenshawarmaalldayeveryday  The highlight of this place is the man at the register, who I assume is the owner. He is always so kind, gracious and friendly. Definitely go and enjoy!  Update: since my initial post, I've tried items other than the chicken shawarma and I did not love it as much. Back to my usual...

photos.caption: Photo of La Shish Kabob - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of La Shish Kabob - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken shawarma to go!
Photo of La Shish Kabob - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Shawarma

37r5nLlqb4R2u-w--ckrRQ.text: This place reminds me of my college days in London. Nothing better than leaving the pub and making your way over to the kabob shop. Seriously, this place is open late, the service is friendly, the food is amazing, and it is cheap. I have never eaten in because lets be real who wants to eat a kebab in a shop when you could have it on your couch with Netflix?   The beef is charred and tasty, the tahini is on point, and the tabouli is to die for. Seriously check this place out! I'm curious about their sweets, those will definitely be on my to do list for next time.

AL9bVRbYbVA_9-MMe_7l0w.text: Great food, although be specific if calling it in, they will charge you twice the price for a combo if not.  I'd give this place its 5th star if they weren't so eager to charge me $11 for a $6 kabob.  It does come with a bunch of rice and a little side salad, but all they would have to do is clarify with me what I wanted and we'd be cool.  I will just ask for a total next time.

oGMM71fSw3NzJ-YGSrsFeg.text: This place is great.  I was was visiting Charlotte for a business purpose while find this place in Yelp. Thought let's  try.    I ordered Lamb Shank and rice. It was the most delicious shank I have ever tried.    Khalidon was very respectful and friendly person. He served the foods very nicely.   I wish to go again and again.

photos.caption: Photo of La Shish Kabob - Charlotte, NC, United States

ZOwO4mwjf0bx6-I4Sciznw.text: My husband ate at La shish kabob today. I need to preface this review by saying that I have been spoiled because I grew up in a middle eastern community in Detroit eating some of the best middle eastern food outside of the middle east.  I know that all middle eastern food it not alike. La Shish Kabob had just opened the first time that I ate there and this review was written after my second visit. Both times my opinions were the same. I just did not feel the food was fresh or health enough. And perhaps it was what I ordered. The first time, the saw the older guy on the grill take the grease with his spatula from the fries and throw it on the shredded chicken on the grill. This time, I played it safe and ordered the Gyro and fries for lunch. The gyro meat was the processed, lunchmeat kind. It was very salty. Everything had lots of red onions. It had very little tzatziki sauce. It's just not the fresh, healthy middle eastern food that I am accustomed to... Sorry! I just do not rate this place highly and would not recommend it to friends. It's a greasy spoon that takes a the kind of short cuts that could they could never get away with in Detroit because there is just too much competition there. Here in Charlotte, they can get away with it. It's okay if you want to get your Middle eastern fix though.  I did not like the service either. Could not even get a cup of ice water. Will not be back.

rpOXhzVsm7RVcEACmpa0YQ.text: Fresh food daily! I order at least once a week, EVERY WEEK!!! The chicken shawarma wrap is amazing! I also like the human shwarma, tabouli salad. The lentil soup is great as well.

CJrp0NiGprrGB67eq03uEw.text: I always see La Shish Kabob in passing and wanted to give it a try.I recently ordered from here not too long ago and did not like my food at all.I ordered the chicken shawrama.It was quite bland despite the seasoning I could see on the food.It was also on the pricey side for what was given which I did not find to be reasonable.I will not be back!

VQfbFUbbbGQXwrtx3QoGtw.text: I have been coming here for years. Not sure why it took me this long to write a review!!! The service customer service is always great. I absolutely love the chicken shawarma!!! The chicken is cooked to perfection. I have also tried the mixed grill which come includes lamb, beef, soup or cucumber/tomato salad. You can't go wrong with anything you choose. I even had the steak and cheese and the chicken philly with fries........delicious. I will be back soon!!!l

photos.caption: Photo of La Shish Kabob - Charlotte, NC, United States. Perfect combination!!!
Photo of La Shish Kabob - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Shawarma

9g9C3woODRaG1-0J-zLtRg.text: The food quality is very good at LA Shish Kabob. I ordered the mixed grill plate with chicken, beef, and lamb over rice. Very yummy and great quality.  I also ordered the Vegetarian plate with hummus, falafel, salad and some other puree substance that was yummy. The falafel was either not fresh or fried too hard and was crumby. Other than that the food was great and I recommend trying them out.

photos.caption: Photo of La Shish Kabob - Charlotte, NC, United States. Vegetarian plate... the falafel was fried too hard or either wasn&#39;t fresh...
Photo of La Shish Kabob - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mixed Grill plate over rice. The yogurt was really good also

g0NrG8eVXU8yW-9R8QpVqQ.text: We love La Shish Kabob! We love finding smaller, authentic international food spots and La Shish is one of the first places we found when we moved to Charlotte 3 years ago. They have recently expanded and business seems to be booming! The owner/head chef is a funny guy and always recognizes us when we come in. Everyone who works there is always polite. The food is EXCEPTIONAL! The best hummus I've ever had, shawarma is phenomenal, and we recently tried the chicken shabousk (?) which is now one of our favorites. It may not be "authentic" but the chicken philly is also something we crave all the time. You should try La Shish Kabob!

photos.caption: Photo of La Shish Kabob - Charlotte, NC, United States. The owner/head chef. He&#39;s so funny. He told us about how he&#39;s famous on Facebook and showed us all of his &#34;likes&#34;!!!

VwxePyA2ier8NJoSGg2Vmg.text: The best lamb in Charlotte! Everything was so flavorful and delicious, go here and do your tastebuds a favor lol.

rcWHrtllKs3Fm2FJaszVkA.text: I am not sure what I love more, the people or the food.  The owner is amazing.  The food is amazing.  The atmosphere is amazing.  It is an outstanding place.  I cannot say enough good!

qpzdAG10KVoY4pb-M8bbqw.text: Very regular customers to this place.  Wife and I love Mediterranean food and found this jewel in the city and so glad we did.  The owner is such a friendly person, greets every time we go there and its so genuine and welcoming.  ok the food, obviously they have great shawrmas, falafels, hummus, various kabobs, baklava etc., but to me the one thing that stands out is the Lamb Shank.  God damn, yes its fatty, full of cholesterol and thousands of calories but trust me, it is worth everything.  I always have the Lamb Shanks with Maklouba rice, not always but as often as possible.  We usually get the whole chicken and rice or chicken kabobs for dinner.  They have expanded recently and have a much bigger dining space than few months before. All this for a very very decent price, its the best Mediterranean place around.

Ke9aYRHVDzZ3FUsnXsC4qQ.text: Omg!!!!!!! This place is hands down one of my favorite places to eat in Charlotte. Their hummus is amazing especially when adding the Serrano peppers! Their falafel is also really good! I haven't been able to find a place that's as good as the food from when I was overseas. Soooo good!

U2gh19KnXDBDFow3J_hx6w.text: I got a large take out order for a party and the food as well as the service was very good.  Prices are ok too.

DW8D6EUQ7cBWN7J2N8A1Wg.text: Best food in town at great prices.  Lamb shank is excellent and lamb Philly best ever had.  Food is top quality and owner very friendly.

0ffZeWM2Kcv85_LlwQdfwg.text: Mmmmm. What more can I say? The meats are delicious, the lamb kabob is my favorite, the spices are so good. The lentil soup is bangin' and that little side of creamy stuff to put in it...do it! The meat plattera come with a huge pile of rice and it's amazing! Just eat here. The owner is awesome and so friendly, as most of the middle eastern places here are.

LvCbtaozViz50IVpWQlNFQ.text: First time eating at this place and I have fallen in love!! I order two entrees: mixed grill and Cornish hen.  Both meals were more than enough food. Everything was cooked perfectly and flavored very well. I loved loved eating every single bite! It took me a few days to eat all of it. These leftovers are the best.

cnc3Wcj_x0sR5V9fQIUrdw.text: Went here with my Mom. She had tabouli  and hummus. I had the mixed kebab plate with rice and lentil soup. We were both very impressed with the taste of the food. Each meat was seasoned perfectly  and not with the same seasoning it seems. The hummus  was so creamy. Those were the stars for us but all dishes were great and the service was super fast. I recommend a dinner here. We are already planning our next order!

photos.caption: Photo of La Shish Kabob - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hummus, lentil soup, tabouli, and mixed kebabs.

lYAIDDTs7dYAF-uzpSJ9RQ.text: A/C not working well, 82 inside and 96 outside.  Middle Eastern food served buffet style for $14.95/plate, plus the cost of drinks.  Food was just ok, Ant liked the different selections of chicken.  Nice owner that greeted us as we came in.

QlwJLJ85xVBsu7Vi9ko-FQ.text: Food is ok, not the best but much better than other places. They charged 2.99 for extra garlic sauce which was un called for; otherwise ok

ixZlBBotGUNb4nRPi326EA.text: I love this place, first it's like a Palestinian deli in NYC, they have freshly made salads, hummus, also Cornish hen, and THR portions a HUGE...so you need to be hungry! The food it's fantastic and you can have also amazing desert! Won't be disappointed!

bCuxxeW9JGwJNE37BpmcxQ.text: Went for lunch on a Sunday - bustling with people for the buffet. Ordered the chicken shawarma plate, a hot wrap filled to the brim with rotisserie chicken. Definitely affordable and delicious - a must stop if you're looking for something different from Latin in the Eastland area.

C_Id6LmQrdovH8-xde1G5w.text: One of my favorite places in Charlotte. It's kind of a hole in the wall, but the food is solid. Go for the shawarma wrap with fries, shawarma with hummus, or the lamb shanks.   The shawarma is seasoned perfectly with allspice and lemon; it's shaved off the spit and finished on the griddle. Usually it's amazing... There have been a few times lately that the chicken has been a little dry, but I remedy that with an extra helping of their garlic sauce and the lemon-olive oil concoction on the tables.   The lamb shank is stewed and it falls off the bone.  The lentil soup is delicious.  They have menu items like burgers, Philly cheesesteaks, lamb cheesesteak, etc. and I'd advise you to stay away.

kI8efcpm6CBPFZ_S7gLLxw.text: If not the best, one of the best middle eastern restaurants I've ever been. The owner is the chef as well. I had shawarma platter and it was awesome. Service is very friendly and you feel at home. I'm recommending this restaurant to all who want to try new taste and those who love kabob.

2a2qhOfmkaZ2EYCuDDHkog.text: They have best lamb in town. Highly recommended. Good service clean place. I will definitely come back.

SEXmEIeeyYwMZynO2aDBsA.text: I love this place.... The best service and amazing food! Wish I lived closer I would be here everyday!

01dU4QI9JvmnWa2LiStoeg.text: Amazing food, amazing prices and everyone was so helpful. They walked us through the menu and explained everything. The veggie plate was great and so was the Gyro Lamb.

photos.caption: Photo of La Shish Kabob - Charlotte, NC, United States

2Yoa2q4ZYXbMZFbN6KaJuQ.text: The lamb shank is delicious. The side dishes are too! The owner has always been friendly and you can tell he takes pride in the food and service at his restaurant.

vu405FPLTvi_5QBD4WuCmg.text: One of the most delicious middle-eastern restaurants. The food is amazing and decent prices.Customer service is gorgeous.. Im from middle-east and as much food as I tried I can tell this is one of the top on my list. Give it a try and you'll know what I mean

4UzVXO1Ob1T1XDeozIdf1w.text: I ordered the lamb shanks, with a side of cucumber salad. The order is not just 1 lamb shank, but 2, and they were good sized shanks.  Falling off the bone good, seasoned so well I decided not to add anything to them. In a fancier restaurant in a different location that alone would be $30 or more, but here it was about $12. This was my first time there, but it's going to be a regular stop from now on.

d_nO1BK3c0j--gVTFNTkmA.text: What a gem. Don't get me wrong this place is a hole in the wall, and from the outside it looks pretty shady. But it is authentic middle eastern food, the hummus, babba ganoush ,  tabouli are so good. They are all served with warm pita that is delish. The owner is very kind, and always happy to recommended his favorites, and the price point is great! Give it a try!

cEqW2JYetOzCdWtVDbr1SA.text: There is plenty on the menu for a plant-based eater. Their fries could use some work, but everything else we've had from here over the last two years is very tasty.   I think a lot of people and the environment where we get our food from would also appreciate to-go containers that are not styrofoam.

_Agg3RgUms2G3dpx0KfxgA.text: Another hidden gem in Charlotte! When my family comes to visit we have to visit La Shish Kabob! Delicious lentil soup, grape leaves and hummus! Always a great meal and the owner is extremely friendly. Highly recommend to check it out if you're looking for a great casual dining spot for Mediterranean.

maGFkwsJj4aYmtntMVlS3A.text: I was so excited to see this place had such great reviews. I haven't found really really good Lebanese/Mediterranean/middle eastern food in charlotte and I've pretty much tried them all (Jasmine Grill is probably the best so far). This was my last hope.    Unfortunately, my visit was combination of all the bad reviews on this place. Just my luck.  I called my order in and had a bit of difficulty understanding the guy on the other end bc he was so short and muffled with his responses. Okay whatever, we got through it.  I went in and expected the owner to be really nice based on reviews.  He was actually an impatient jerk.   He changed one of the items I ordered saying it's almost the same so I asked what I ended up getting. Expecting this food to be amazing, I wanted to know so that I could reorder the right item next time. Wow you'd think this guy would be even MODERATELY polite when getting a reasonable question. Whatever. I can deal with a gruff jerk for good food.   Yeah well not. The shawarma wrap was dry as my heel in the winter and completely tasteless.  What?!?!??  How can this be?  Then went onto the mixed grill.  :(. WTH. So dry. Everything. Rice meats all so so dry. Only flavors were salt and too much of that. I try to smother it with the garlic (how can garlic sauce be so tasteless????) and hot sauce.  I took one bite of the salad and spit it out. The tomatoes were old and mushy. The whole salad was tasteless and old. The tabouli was also old. One bite and I had to spit it out. It was so old it had actually started the fermentation process!!!!!  Finally I stopped realizing I was basically eating junk.  The ONLY decent thing we tried was the Falafel. It was pretty good.  Good but falafel alone isn't reason for me to come back to be treated like crap for dry salty low quality food.  So either I got unlucky and the GROUCH served me the worst dry tasteless leftovers or others who give this a great review have never had really good Lebanese.

photos.caption: Photo of La Shish Kabob - Charlotte, NC, United States. Had to spit this out too. Seriously. So old it started the fermentation process.
Photo of La Shish Kabob - Charlotte, NC, United States. Had to spit this out. So mushy and old

hz6NVrKroyKeqardHoLmNw.text: Really good food!  I've eaten at quite a few Mediterranean places and I enjoyed this one.  I had the gyro sandwich, it was delicious.  I prefer the gyro carved from the spit, but this was not.  The pita was fresh and the cucumber salad was yummy along with the sauce.  My wife had the New York schwarma and loved the flavors.  She said it was different from others she's had, but very good.  My son had the ground beef  kabob and loved it.   I had some too excellent flavor.  My wife and I enjoyed the lentil soup, but my son did not.  The owner was very nice.  The location is busy, not the best location in a strip mall.  The decor is pretty minimal and the buffet tables take up the back of the restaurant even when not in use.  Maybe a good carryout place, but not a terrible place to eat.  The food makes it all worth it.

vO8nyxYCSDhY6Fxhb76t_g.text: Really Loved dinner here.  Did pick up on a particularly busy night so I didn't mind the wait. There were three guys killings themselves to be timely and get to everyone and I am grateful for the hustle despite the wait.   We ordered the 3 appetizer combo with falafel, grape leaves and hummus.  And shared the Mixed Grill plate.  Perfect for two and even was able to take some for lunch!    The food was warm, fresh and the flavors were everything we wanted!  Thank you for a great dinner experience. Can't wait to come back and try the all you can eat Buffett ($15) or more food!

photos.caption: Photo of La Shish Kabob - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menus inside
Photo of La Shish Kabob - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menus inside.

c2UnZaocYlF67W76j0JB3g.text: We received such a wonderful welcome from who I believe was the owner. The buffet was full of great choices. The lamb, kefta and schwarma wraps are delicious. I haven't had hummus this good since being in the Middle East. It's just perfectly whipped and wetter than you find elsewhere. Thank you for a great family meal!!!

egTYIGN0Qy0PIjqZJvLKDw.text: Pretty good. I am not completely a meat and potatoes type of girl thus I am more drawn to sharwarma with pickles and greens but I have to say the meat was good. I also ordered hummus which was also good. A little on the chunkier side which is not everyone's favorite. Note they have a lunch buffet which is great way to try a variety of traditional Arabic dishes especially if you are a newbie to Arabic cuisine.

f2ZbR1L7yksZwJWj8yhhSQ.text: This is one of my favorite, "quick grabs." Owner is friendly, food comes out quickly, and the food is great. My favorite menu items: falafel, hummus, baba ganoush, lentil soup.

niCNEl99fmlzAAXRkLIlDg.text: No tables settings of napkin knife and fork.  Had to ask receptionist for utensils to eat with. Ordered salad and chicken kabobs. Salad. contained a large spoon to eat with. Then main dish chicken kabobs came before I could even take one bite of my salad. Had to try and find waitress to get more water. The same for more pita bread. Chicken kabobs were absolutely horrible. They were extremely dry chunks of chicken that were also difficult to chew. The taste of the kabobs was not good at all. Some raisins were hard as rocks. What raisins that were not hard and the rice were unfortunately the best parts of the whole meal. We kept waiting for our check so long the receptionist finally came up and asked if we needed our check. A small discount for the bad bobs was given, but not nearly enough. Will never go back to this place. Save your money. The rating of one is a gift and higher than deserved. Bypass this place.

DX7o7q62ySc-Ud5UsToHiw.text: Very legit! I've been trying to go here for awhile, but live closer to my favorite Kabob Je, another delicious place. I was stuck at home and saw La Shish Kabob on Uber Eats and figured it's time to give them a shot.  All I can say is wow! I don't think I've ever had better hummus or shwarma. Simply fantastic, and the skewers were expertly seasons. My favorite Mediterranean restaurant now has competition.

g2EQ0bdF7E3_9hkX2DsyJA.text: I left Charlotte a few years ago for New York City and this is still my favorite chicken shawarma. I make it a point to eat here at least once every time I  come home to visit. Everyone is so friendly and warm and the food never disappoints!

QyGprStJs31TyJu2rpa6TA.text: The food was okay but the customer service was pathetic. The cashier was so arrogant as if he was only one who has everything in the world. He neither greeted nor smiled.

ASYFGpnWVChy9pvSfZz_Mg.text: Hidden Gem, the food is extremely tasty, the lamb is succulent and seasoned well. The buffet gives you a nice variety, it is a good restaurant for vegetarians and carnivores.

kZJf_SOzf2NOHUyQbz86hg.text: Great place with delicious food and excellent service. Visited for the first time over the labor day weekend and will definitely be back! Veggie platter is excellent, great portions and awesome flavors.

4TVt0n2cVj_rqiqyiuQh4g.text: Update: They have updated their menu and resturant!! Love this place!! It doesn't look like much but it always great whenever we go. Especially when they have their buffet available. We always get their chicken biriani, humus and lentil soup. The staff is so welcoming and extremely helpful when you can't decide what to get. We will definitely come back since they're always up late. We got the rice and beef plate. Absolutly delicious!

7eXFXP90Q-6AnSzkorlrhw.text: Their meat is mediocre and was served cold two different times I visited. People were nice.

4su9xaemaWKVHQ2K1Prxvw.text: I was in the mood for falafel and that didn't disappoint, but I ordered takeout and part of my order was missing. Other than that, the food that I got was amazing. The greek salad is delicious even though I asked for no feta cheese.

ozEW9WiTEtQ2u-FmXPTAjg.text: This food is addictive. If I could put the baba gonoush in my veins, I would, it's so flavorful. I loved the beef kebabs and get the lentil soup as your side, so good.

aXV_VxKeeYuWN5COQY3HgQ.text: FANTASTIC!! We went to this place on a whim and boy was it the most pleasant surprise! I got the NY Shawarma meal with lentil soup, boyfriend got the shawarma wrap and mom got the falafel wrap, all mouthwatering and amazing. We got a hummus plate for the table and you could definitely tell it was homemade, it was to die for! The owner was very sweet and welcoming, he greeted us with a big smile on his face and made sure we were satisfied with our meals. I will definitely be back here the next time I am in Charlotte!

2cwZ9v0rCzc0noYG1io-Eg.text: Amazing and authentic Mediterranean cuisine! The baba ghannouj is delicious. The owner is so attentive and will make sure you love what you get! Fast service.

NoKQkZr-IT1YWj4EikwkDg.text: Every time I visit my family in Charlotte, we always seem to stumble upon some fun strip mall with a bunch nondescript ethnic restaurants. Last Monday afternoon was no different, and we found ourselves at La Shish Kebob.   As soon as we walked inside, we had a good feeling about the place. The guys behind the counter were jovial, the TV was blaring news in a language neither of us understood, and there were a ton of beverages in the fridge case that neither of us recognized.   My cousin got a lamb kebab wrap, and I ordered the chicken shawarma plate. We shared an app plate of hummus, kibbeh, and falafel.   Everything was just fantastic. The hummus was some of the best I've had, and the large pita was warm and fresh. The falafel was superb: crunchy on the outside, tender on the inside, and obviously fried to order. The kibbeh, which I'd never tried, was also outstanding: to me, it was like the Middle Eastern version of arancini, and I loved it. The meat was spiced well and the rice was not dry or crunchy.   Cousin loved his lamb kebab wrap; I enjoyed my shawarma wrap as well. The chicken was a little dry, but it wasn't anything the hot sauce, lemon-garlic sauce, and garlic mayo couldn't fix. It also came with fries, which were nothing spectacular, but went well with the garlic mayo (and really, you don't go to a kebab place for the fries!).   Price was more than reasonable and the portions were generous.   The service was also fantastic; not sure if the guy serving and ringing us up was the owner, but he was very nice and very enthusiastic about everything. We thanked him profusely before waddling our fat asses back to the car.

U0mI6lsEMptJWzsC9C8HQg.text: La Shis KaBOMB !  Cheap...fresh....excellent flavors...nice people !!  Ya just cannot beat it !

ynbxJts_odDs7SS2SDVN8w.text: Local Middle Eastern eats! You seriously cannot beat La Shish Kabob. It is inexpensive, fast and DELICIOUS! Their lentil soup and vegetable/special rice are the best things in the house. Their lamb shanks are a close second. The location is a bit on the seedy side, but it is worth the detour. Lots of regular eaters at La Shish; it is that good! What are you waiting for? GO!

ZUWnVKcYjgG0YWfPqSva3w.text: This place is authentic, delicious and a True gem here in Charlotte. Recommend anyone to come here and finish with a desert. You won't regret it

ioMoagFcxNTn8oV6vRLKig.text: We used to live right around the corner several years ago and drove by it all the time, but never stopped.  I used to live in Washington, DC and loved the kabob places (Moby Dick, for one) there and was looking to find a favorite here in Charlotte.  As has been mentioned, this is a little deli looking place in a small, old strip center.  Neighborhood has been a downward slide for years (even though we enjoyed living over here), but location and physical appearance shouldn't be a determining factor when choosing specialty cuisine.  This is a more traditional kabob stop than you might find in Dilworth or Ballantyne.  It's very traditional with a very good menu.  We always choose the mixed grill kabobs with the special rice (includes grilled eggplant) and a salad with a nice lemon dressing.  Lots of food and the meat is always cooked just right.  This was not what I was looking for originally to match what I used to get in Washington, DC, which was much different fare, but it has been a nice discovery.  Kabobs aren't kabobs everywhere with the different ethnic regions each having their unique styles and ingredients.  This still very much fits the bill for what we were looking for and we will continue to come here for a good meal.

rhZ9CoBWWzf1Qa36g6iqCQ.text: The owner is super friendly and the gyros and whole chicken are really good. It can get kind of crowded, and the place is small, but the food totally makes up for that.

hx9YwMuWnjDoICc0SFmf_g.text: All I've ever had here are Falafels to go, and an occasional bite from my husband's chicken shawarma. They're good. And at less than four dollars, fine for the money. That's about it. No excellence, but when I want a cheap meal that isn't a traditional sandwich, I'll always be happy to go back there. The Tabouleh is veeerry lemony - some like it that way, I personally don't.   The owner is very friendly, and when I was digging for cash the other day, he offered that I could just pay next time I came in. Five stars on the service.

qoY9-6Fbi4mzo-YfCF5MKQ.text: This little restaurant is a gem. The owner is a sweetheart and recognize me each time I come in. The food is good and you can find healthy items on the menu. I eat there every Other Thursday when I'm on that side of town.

IN4WWeabLXgj0yOh9Fqikw.text: This place is my JAM! Thankfully, I'm located less than 2 minutes from this little gem of a place and since discovering it on 9/29, I've been 6 times. That's right - 6 times in 8 days.  I can't get enough of their falafel wrap, and let me explain why:  1. 2.99 - with tax, total comes out to $3.64 2. Falafel is so moist, yet perfectly fried - it's a miracle and sin all in one 3. The salad they put on it is always fresh, light and cool 4. Please see #1 & #2 5. Izzat is always there and while I can't understand a word of what he says over the phone, when I walk in he is always smiling and asking after my health (Perhaps he wants to be sure I am in good health so I can continue to put his kids through college thanks to the rate at which he sees me). 6. Please see #1-5  So yes, I am in LURVE with this place and you should definitely try it. I've also had the grape leaves (good, salty though!), the hummos (home run, all the way, amazing) and the Babaganoush (yummy). An accomplice on one of my visits tried the Chicken wrap and before I could ask for a bite it was gone, so that also says something ;)  As others have said, don't let the shanty strip mall it's in get you down - this really is a very real, honest establishment that appears to really hold onto their roots and rock the Casbah of tastebuds in my mouth!

kucYPjtz20o9-dL-Vwj_MQ.text: Amazing food.  The best middle eastern food hands down.  The service was fast and friendly as well.

5IcmZKVF0qZtjAGV_iGhKQ.text: My first visit and I ordered food to-go. The smells coming from the grill were unreal. I opted for the app sampler (I picked hommus, stuffed grape leaves, and kibbeh), a small order of the falafel, and a combo shish kabob plate with rice and salad. The only item I had ever had before was the grape leaves and hommus. It was life changing! Kibbeh is my new favorite food. They look like giant hush puppies but are stuffed with meat and almonds and a mind-blowing amount of flavor. The rice was delicious and the grilled meats on top were perfectly seasoned. Can't wait to go back!!

Zy7RgUPBqk1BIKe3TqVriQ.text: Holy crap is this place good.  When a co-worker said he wanted to take me to grab Palestinian grub for lunch, I'll admit, I wasn't that excited.  He saw it advertised in the Observer.  When we pulled up outside of the strip mall where this place is located, I was less excited.  Stepping inside your eyes won't be impressed, but your nose will, and soon, so will your tastebuds.  Nothing fancy about this joint, but the food is outstanding (they were actually cooking an authentic Jordanian dish as a lunch special) and the service is warm.  I tried the Shwarma meal, which is two slightly grilled pitas stufed with chicken shwarma, veggies, and a cool sauce served with slaw and fries.  Really good.  Coworkers ordered chicken shish kabob wraps and kafta wraps.  Both claimed they were outstanding.  The hummus at the table behind us looked great, too.   Maybe the best part, though, is that the meal was cheap.  Ridiculously cheap.    You can even grab seasoned rotisserie chickens in a family deal to go...something like two chickens, rice, a side (I think) for something like $24.  Not a bad deal.  If they were located on East Blvd, they would have a line out the door every day during lunch and could charge twice as much.  Not very many places to sit inside, so arrive in an "off" time or plan on getting it to go.  Great work.  Looking forward to going back.

JnZLZqETZeK6vY8A8Jya8Q.text: Since I've moved to Charlotte three years ago (from southeastern Michigan), I have been in search of a place like this.  I have settled for mediocre Middle Eastern places in Charlotte to satisfy my cravings, but now La Shish Kabob is here for fresh, flavorful, reasonably priced Mediterranean cuisine.  I came in on a whim during Ramadan.  The place was packed with families seated at tables connected together who were served family-style.  They were beyond busy, and I should've known better.  I came just at the moment they were all breaking fast.  In the midst of waiters rushing to serve their guests, a friend of the owners (I presumed) got up and took my order preceded by an offering to try a fig...which I took.  Yum.  They later offered me a stuffed grape leaf while I was waiting for my order.  Double yum.  I ordered a sampling of food: falafel, kibbeh, chicken shwarma, hommos, baba ghanouj, and three honey-coated pastries that had a cream filling.  Everything was tasty, subtle flavors of fresh herbs, large portions, very filling...yummy leftovers.  So, Charlotteans, let's keep this new eatery open.  Try it out.  You won't be disappointed. It's worth it, I promise.    If you're new to Middle Eastern cuisine, this will be a great introduction. Looking for a new take out to bring home that won't burn a whole in your wallet?  This is your place.  You are also looking for the "real deal"? Head there now : )

kOFPjUWGpKdSBZHnnHz-FQ.text: Short and sweet. The best food of its kind in Charlotte. I eat here very often because no establishment in town make shwarma anywhere near as good.

fsnYZIcfDEwOk_dNm6Wa4g.text: Amazing food. Amazing service. Amazing prices. If you're in the mood for middle eastern cuisine in Charlotte do not look further. I've tried them all and this takes the top spot.

hnRH9JIIpMzkAitK6B_-xw.text: What can I say that already has not been said? Everything we have ever eaten there is kick*ss. So if you ever go to another "Middle Eastern" food joint, beware. This place sets a high standard. This is the only place we would eat at in Charlotte. Well, we did go to the Penguin when it was good, but then it changed management... Anyway, grab a bite here. You will probably come back a few days later, it is that good. The lamb on rice, OMG. It is a huge portion, so go in hungry. And the flavor is like no other, incredible. The Fattoush salad is amazing. Get the Family Meal and go for a picnic then play some disc golf and go back and get the Lamb Shank. Well worth the drive from Cornelius. We miss this joint.

NCeYbiZxMTjntahaVRZuSA.text: The food is outstanding here, the best Middle Eastern/Halal I've had in Charlotte. We had several dishes -- hummus and pita, falafel, kafta, beef shawarma, meat pies. All first rate. The salads are fresh and very well prepared as well. Service is fast, the owner/manager is a great guy, and the prices are inexpensive. The space itself is pretty pedestrian -- think late-night diner -- but it is clean and well maintained.

GtVCcCXM_ocuWJQFjDhg8Q.text: Some of the best middle eastern food around Charlotte, looks like a hole in the wall but being from NY you know that is where some of the best quality food is served. I have come here probably a dozen times since moving to Charlotte and not once have I been disappointed. Dine in is equally as enjoyable, again do not mind the atmosphere the people around you are all enjoying the food and conversation, and the staff is extremely kind. One of my top 5 food spots in the Queen City.

dLjNSeqKFEBivxswMWERtA.text: Every time I dine here, it's delicious!  The Schwerma and mixed meat plate combined with garlic sauce is to die for!

3Xcw0212TWa3nuRf0c1Jjg.text: It was late on that hot and muggy Carolina Friday, and most places were closed, but their sign caught my eye. The smell of falafel was a delicious draw, so we decided to stop in.   This is not a restaurant. This is a hub.   The small restaurant was full of good sights, smells, and the chatter of friendly people in languages I didn't understand. Women in headscarves talked animatedly to eachother while scooping up laughing children to sit on their laps. Families talked to all tables as they sat down to delicious food.  Behind the counter, herbed beef, chicken, and lamb sizzled as music from Jerusalem sounded over the system.   Meet Izzat. He opened La Shish Kabob about two months ago after moving his family here from Jerusalem. When he invites you into his restaurant, it's like he's inviting you into his home. We gladly took a seat.  SERVICE: Astounding. Very pleasant and hospitable, and when I realized that I had accidentally ordered something with onions and green peppers (my friend is allergic), they instantly made another one and apologized even though it was my err. Instead of the original lamb kebab that was ordered, he made something that was a little different to better suit my friend's food requirements, without even being asked. And it was delicious.  FOOD: If you've never experienced good Middle Eastern food, experience it here. They have all of the classics, from falafel to baba ghannouj. The tabouli was out of this world (so much better than I make, I'm going to have to snag his recipe), with that clean and fresh parsley, lemon and olive oil flavor.  The kebab wraps (chicken and lamb) were flavorful and huge. They also sell the brand of mango nectar there that tastes like you're drinking a whole mango. Delicious. The baklavah and other goodies in the case looked mouth-watering, but I was too full. That comes on round 2.  PRICE: This is the awesome part. A heaping portion of tabouli for two, two lamb kebab wraps, one chicken kebab wrap, and 4 mango drinks comes out to: $26. So cheap for not only the portion size, but the quality and freshness as well.  When you walk into this place, you can feel that it's good people. If you stay, you'll quickly realize that it's good people, AND great food. When it's all over, you'll also see that it's all for a really affrodable price. I highly suggest giving this place some love, because it's one of the few places that will give it back.

8M0we7c3lhvtbH6LcQzCvA.text: Oh wow the philly cheese steak is amazing. The owner had the best memory when you place orders. He doesn't even need to know your name. Pick up orders are fresh and ready quick.

ZfFRyk1_dTKfoOY9-CJPqQ.text: Ok! so, the price on the menu board doesn't match with the price that I've been charged, the amount of food was good but I noticed a piece of metal in the Taboli plate, where did it come from, i think from the dish washing materials, so I went to report the problem and all what i got is an angry face from the owner that does most of the stuff usually and I even saw him earlier standing with his shoes on the dining table to fix the ceiling fan, and finally I wasn't impressed with the way they deal with customers and they charged me for water also.

ed8h-pOvtVTGX0UGnWdMBA.text: Wow that was really good. Had the #6 beef kabob. Picked a soda out of the nearby fridge. Great people watching, this place caters to a truly international crowd. The tightly packed tables gave it a communal vibe. I'll be back!

hMl5oRE0YZmQjQBJ7-_FGQ.text: Have been here a couple times now and have had mostly good experiences. I tried the kibbeh, tabouli, hummus, lamb kabob sandwich and shwarma. I've enjoyed everything, especially the hummus, except for the shwarma. Honestly, I've had better. But that's not enough to keep me from going back. The place always smells so awesome and there's still a million things on the menu I haven't tried yet!

cvCzxdvjX10G7fJsAGiHaA.text: This place is everything that is RIGHT about the middle east. Great service, Great food, a crappy atmosphere that just screams "We are serving amazing food not supplying comfy chairs".   I cant wait to return, truly a hidden gem.

VvPuH9e6rKJgCYMBDRmmYg.text: super!!! I am a bit of a critic when it comes to good Middle Eastern food especially since I have some of the best cooks in my family.  The "special rice" is a must order.  It is so savory and literally melts your mouth. The vegetarian selection here is awesome!    The man who own this place is a hoot!  The first time I came in he had his adorable little daughter at the counter and the interaction between the two of them was priceless.  I have been coming at least 3 times per week!  You will not find a better place to delight your tastebuds!

nMh-rtkulq2_hmnogSqipQ.text: This place is one of Charlotte's best in my opinion.  The location is in the rugged N. Sharon Amity Rd & Albermarle Rd area, but is surrounded by other restaurants and markets catering to the Middle Eastern community.  The food is reasonably priced and tastes superb.  The Turkish coffee is well worth a try as well, although don't expect it to be similar to your run of the mill stuff --- which is precisely why it's good.  I've been here 3 times, but only been able to eat there twice.  Before going the first time, I called to make sure they would be open late and was told they would be open until 11pm (not midnight like on the Yelp page).  When we got there all of the chairs and tables were outside and they were ripping up the floor and they were obviously closed for the evening.  This was at 10pm on Valentine's day, but while we were disappointed we were still undeterred.  The next couple times we had the tabbouleh which was quite good, but like another poster said it is pretty lemony and also has a lot more liquid in it than one's I've previously had.  It is still very good though.  It comes with a pita, but we had to remind the guy the first time after which he gave us one pita (not enough) and the second time we automatically got two.     We also had the combination kebab plate with rice which was really good.  The second time we went my GF really wanted the rice (she loved it) and asked the guy if he could just sell us some rice, but he said that he couldn't and that since he isn't the owner he couldn't make the choice.  (we secretly wondered about that since he's always there and sometimes has his family there! haha, but oh well!)  The hummus/hommos is also good.  We also had a schwarma and a falafel our second time eating there and really liked them both.  Our Middle Eastern friend who joined us was a little ambivalent to it all so I still am not sure what he thought of it.  A lot of Middle Easterners frequent this place which is a good sign.  I really liked the food and I am dying to go back.  The people are hospitable and the prices reasonable.  The place's decor is no frills, but when the food is that good you don't need to dress things up.

fgp3Htt1aa7JVC4XaFQ2Wg.text: I actually went to this restaurant because of the Yelp reviews. The reviews were so correct. The people were so friendly and the food was delicious. I am so glad I found a really good resturant that is close to my job. I have shared the menu with all of my co-workers because they said my food was smelling wonderful throughout the office.

eVL4Cy7afIKT5CC8QGpSZg.text: If you love kabobs and gyros/middle Eastern food...this place is a bit too bland and everyday. The chicken shawarma was super dry and it definitely needed more sauce. The falafels were dry and not flavorful and the lamb gyro was decent. You will find better gyros on east boulevard or even the little village grill. The owner was super nice and friendly but not worth going out of your way at all

Ol-hMezMtc6SwgW7KdRNNA.text: The staff was rude and the falafels were stale. I have no intents on returning. When I called to place the carry-out order the staff practically hung up on me without taking a name or telling me how long of a wait or giving me a total. I should have not even bothered to pick it up (dummy move #1). When I arrived, the place was very hectic. Customers were gathered around the counter in no particular fashion. Finally somehow I eventually made it to the counter, although there was never ever really any line or anything, where there was a guy behind it on the phone. He didn't greet me, but acknowledged me with a glare and I told him the order I placed. My second opportunity/cue to just leave...Nevertheless I paid and he placed my order on the counter without a word and walked away. I get home only to find dry falafels that apparently were not fresh. Nor were any of the other items in my order worthy. Total waste.

KudGAWW0f9qSW6xxSJVWKA.text: This is some phenomenal Mediterranean food that won't break the bank. I have eaten here a few times and it leaves me always wanting more of their food. Each item is perfectly prepared with a great mixture of spices and flavors.  The one tip I will share in this review is that all Mediterranean food is very similar, but it's also very different. So if you're looking for a specific dish you might not find it here because while it's Mediterranean food, it's really Lebanese. This creates dishes with slightly different spices but still a delight for any Mediterranean food lover.

oK-5k1c_GVQhWC9bGcVo6A.text: Great fresh food. I always enjoy come big here. It has been awhile but so happy I picked up some kabob dinners and salads to go tonight! Yum!

vkUxdDaO0eI4UrJy3-XGxA.text: Falafel pitas, with hot sauce?  Delish! Hummus?  Delish! Tabbouleh?  Delish! Babba ganoush?  Delish!  Service?  Outstanding!  (The owner loves children... has a gaggle of them himself.)  Price?  5 pitas, hummus, tabbouleh, baba ganoush, and a bag of pitas ~$25.00  The BEST picnic to-go in Charlotte.

aI1bFgkzV-y6zipLbFkZhQ.text: This is definitely one of those places that make me grateful for Yelp, because I never would have found it without it. I would give it 5 stars for service, value, grilled kabobs, buttery delicious baklava and hommos.  The chicken was really well-seasoned and perfectly cooked (often kabobs can be burnt and cardboardy). We were really pleased with our meals that were so reasonably priced.  What deducted a star for me is the odd deli ambiance with trays of food sitting out as well as the baba ghanoush which missed the mark for me. Perhaps it is the traditional way they prepare it in Jerusalem, but I prefer the more Greek/Morroccan way with more eggplant/lemon than creamy white stuff. Yeah, I said it. No creamy white stuff for me. (Good thing I'm never running for office.)  I got three pieces of baklava for the office mates to go which were a major crowd pleaser. They were more buttery than typical Greek baklava than I've had, but I really enjoyed it.   A great alternative if you're stuck in the midlands of Charlotte at a car dealership and your food tank is running on empty. I'll definitely be back.

Su47Hnva8AOdsFegwpEOYQ.text: Try to place an order and the spanish speaking man who was trying to get the order was rude by telling me to hurry up with the order because he was busy..

QD3ydmYy9OsX1x4cXu4eUg.text: Delicious I ordered the chicken kabobs, hummus and falafel balls all of which were well seasoned, fresh and authentic. You can tell the owners or the establishment take pride in the product they are serving and the freshness! Amazing food!

photos.caption: Photo of La Shish Kabob - Charlotte, NC, United States. Best Greek/Mediterranean food I have ever had!

XvhmzxrthDELdherG7mAhw.text: What are the other reviewers talking about?  This place is horrible!  Do not eat here!!  We went there for lunch on a Sunday.  The place itself looked shabby but it had a lot of people there eating so we decided to give it a try because of the great reviews on Yelp.  We ordered our food at the register and payed for it.  Then I noticed that the cook was handling the money with gloves on but then goes back to cooking without changing gloves!!  I was pretty grossed out but I figured we had already paid for the food so I was going to eat it and pray that we don't get sick from it!  The food was not that great!  We barely ate any of it!!  Then after we had finished we went back to our car and we were sitting there for a minute in the parking lot looking up directions and the cook knocks on our car window!  We opened the door and he says "You not pay me!"  So we told him that we payed when we ordered the food and then he just walked away!  What a strange experience!!

c3zP1X2bDEvQaW_0S7vxBw.text: Delicious!  Fresh and great service.  Here for first time... Very helpful in choosing items from the menu.

E953pAFDJJYsV2pxkhxEbQ.text: One of the best spots in NC great food their lamp shanks and half chicken with rice is amazing, the owner is very friendly , Shawera is amazing and prices are very very reasonable every time I go to Charlotte I have to pay a visit to la shish Kabob

P6DFZRURfeoH8Hl0XLG_3g.text: Horrible.... I am so sorry to have to write this, but it turns out to be a must.   Inconsistency can kill a restaurant and it just killed it for me at La Shish. Still shaking my head over this one.   So this is the second time (mind you in a row) that my order was horrible. And now, they screwed up my mothers order -- she is 100 times worse than I when it comes to food, but we both behave the same... once,  okay we will try it again... twice, more than like not again. And if we decided to try it again, it will be a day far away.    I ordered the Arabic Shawarma chicken wrap (both times) and it was bland ass boring and last night out right gross. If I wanted plain chicken thrown on a flat grill with no seasoning, I could of did that myself thank you. And the tahini -- was that mayo or tahini... BOTH TIMES. Argh.   My mother ordered the Lamb Kebob's and the cook added so much hot sauce she couldn't eat it. Mind you she loves hot sauce, but on a Lamb kebob, that should be the customers choice, not the cook going rogue! (the Kebob, which she always orders has NEVER had hot sauce on it before)   And the hommos... smh... there was so much sumac, it was inedible. It was so bitter.   What a shame... I love their prices and I did love the flavor. My mom thinks its the cook... the young one is not supervised, where the older one understands the flavor and seasoning level.   Only reason it got two stars is because my fathers order was ok -- he got the vegetarian wrap.   Another one bites the dust.

TXgfL3qsFFjAHAi7fzsnVA.text: Talk about authentic and delicious!!!!   I had the mixed grille and wanted more even with it being so much food....lamb, beef and chicken. Plus hummus, fresh bread and cucumber/onion/tomato salad. All fresh and so good.   The best part was the service. I haven't felt more welcome any place else since coming to Charlotte. I WILL be back!!!

photos.caption: Photo of La Shish Kabob - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mixed Grille Deliciousness!!!!

BteCev8QYHPMaVwlWrLETg.text: The fooooooood! It's actually been a long while since I've eaten here and and I tell you, I've been missing out! The biggest change I've noticed is that they are now seasoning their kabobs. Although it was still delicious, I used to have to add salt to the kabobs, not anymore...thank goodness. Delish.
