mBlXkQ0geII-aajLc-NVnw.text: Izzat for Mayor! While the food at La Shish Kabob is undeniably delicious, the owner, Izzat, is what makes this spot really special. Rarely can I even open the door myself before Izzat is there, flinging it open, welcoming us in with a big smile and warm greetings. He is truly a Charlotte gem, adding not only great food but out of this world hospitality and kindness to our community. If the restaurant isn't totally packed when you visit, take some time to chat with Izzat and learn his story about moving his restaurant (and family) from Jerusalem to east Charlotte. It's one of resiliency and hard work that will make you love him and La Shish even more than you did before.   Once inside, I always have order anxiety as the smells of slow roasting shawarma and kabobs envelope me. It's impossible not to order hummus, so just go ahead and plan on that. Freshly made and creamy, with olive oil drizzled on top, it's the stuff dreams are made of. I also love the babaganoush (roasted eggplant spread/dip) and tabbouleh (minced parsley, mint, olive oil, and who knows what else goodness), and falafel. Oh, the falafel! Also totally dreamy. In case you're not full just reading this, the chicken shawarma is also delish and served with french fries that are perfect to dip in the garlic mayo. So, pretty much, just order one of everything and plan to take a lot home to snack on for days after.

photos.caption: Photo of La Shish Kabob - Charlotte, NC, United States. Babaganoush, hummus, tabbouleh, and falafel

8VICaTllqnObOTne48jNLQ.text: All these raving reviews are 100% right!   Tried La Shish Kabob for the first time last night. I've been curious after seeing it rated as one of the best places to get hummus in Charlotte by Charlotte Agenda.  We ordered the following items:  Hummos Dip Appetizer Grape Leaves Appetizer  Kofta Kabob Wrap Mixed Grilled Kabob Entree  Everything was so delicious! The hummos dip was served with huge pieces of fresh pita, we had our food delivered by Ubereats--I can only imagine how good the pita is when served right there. Very tasty and very much deserving of it's title as one of the best in Charlotte.  Grape Leaves were served cold, which I prefer--I've had them warm and wasn't as big of a fan. Stuffed with rice, tomato and parsley they were really yummy. Appetizer comes with 6 in it.  Kofta Kabob Wrap was HUGE--wrapped in warm pita and served with with lettuce, tomato, pickles, onion and hummus. Was especially great with the hot sauce provided.   Mixed Grilled Kabob Entree was the absolutely favorite. You get to try chicken, lamb and kofta served on a giant bed of rice. The portion size was insane, had it for lunch today! This is also served with a fresh small salad.  Try this place out, you won't regret it! Price was low and portions were big!

CE5OUyHd4s6TNexQaXabUQ.text: I'm always looking for a good Halal restaurant and I think I found it. I love lamb and their lamb was pretty good, will be back to try other menu items.

RDwnlPh_gvIvpTnQKV7EuA.text: Loved this place!  My niece and I stopped in for a quick lunch thisWe ordered the swarma platter and kibbeh.  Both were delicious and with very generous portions  We thought we would have a doggie bag to take home but we managed to eat all of it.  This is a bare bones little restaurant, but very clean and neat. The owner was so friendly and the food well prepared and seasoned.  I hope to be back very soon!

photos.caption: Photo of La Shish Kabob - Charlotte, NC, United States

0f0Yd_lTO3N0AYgm76DAxw.text: I discovered this place when I lived in Davidson and still to this day come to La Shish Kabob every single time I'm in Charlotte. My boyfriend and I will even make the drive from Durham under the guise of a 'getaway' but it's really so we can eat at La Shish Kabob.  Everything here is amazing but the lamb shank is truly out of this world. Our other favorite is the baklava - it's soft and wonderful and unlike any baklava you'll ever try (and I'm from Egypt).   Finally, the owner is the nicest man! He greets everyone as brother, sister, or friend and wants all his customers to be completely satisfied. Do yourself a favor and give this place a try for authentic Arabic meal.

vTLhrY5vuGXlcB9noeeHyA.text: A remarkably decent place for Charlotte. Great flavors (note you must(!) season yourself) on Kabobs, hummus, etc. Only 4 stars because generally all meats are over cooked (well done). Be sure to ask them for Med at most.

xSzawhQEXorxcRn14aXO6w.text: Best kabobs in town. They also have lunch and dinner buffet in the weekend. Great way to try Mediterranean food if you are not into kabobs.

og10iXgRBIk4epLnJbJxPQ.text: The food here is amazing! The falafel, baba ghanosh, and hummus are delicious! I frequented this restaurant until today--I will never spend my money here again!!!  I ordered food over my lunch break for a friend to pick up. The other day I asked if I could get tabbouleh included on my falafel wrap w/ fries and the owner's daughter told me of course! The flavors were amazing. Today, I inquired whether I could do it again and the employee either did not understand or did not want to do it (they told me they don't speak English), so I just forgot about it. I eat the wrap without it any other day, right? When my friend brings the food, the pita was stale, the falafel was super mushy like it had been undercooked, the fries were old tasting. Since my break was ending, I called the store to speak of my experience given me eating there often (within the past seven days at least 3 times) to let them know I was unsatisfied. The employee asked me if I wanted a refund or the food made over. I went with the refund given I had not enjoyed the food and did not want to take a second chance for the day.   My friend goes to get the refund and calls me frustrated because the owner tells him that he would not give a refund without the food. By this point since the employee had told us to just come get the refund and not mentioned the food, it had been disposed of. I called while at work to speak to the owner. He accuses me of wanting my money back because I didn't get tabbouleh on my wrap!! I have eaten here for over FIVE years and have NEVER complained about an item. At this point I tell the owner that I don't have the food and since we were told that I could have a refund that I should be given one. He repeatedly said things that left just as bad as a taste in my mouth as the food he'd served us. I hung up.   Once I got off work, I went back to the restaurant to speak to the owner myself. He told us we were playing games and he would not give us the money back. I told him I would not leave until I got my refund at the point because I was being accused of things that made absolutely no sense. I begin leaning on his counter and he tells me to have a seat and I could stay there as long as I wanted and I told him I'd be there until I got my money back.   What did he do?  HE CALLED THE POLICE ON ME AND SAID THAT HE WAS AFRAID OF WHAT I WOULD DO TO HIM. I have video footage of the encounter that shows me leaning against his counter and him sticking his hand in my face. I am a 23 y/o woman and he is too old with a DAUGHTER THAT WORKS THERE to be treating someone else's daughter that way. I was appalled. He begins to move his tip jars because he said I was probably going to try to steal from him even after I'VE GIVEN HIM MY MONEY AND RECOMMENDED THIS PLACE FOR YEARS.   Ultimately, I received more back than I paid because one of his other loyal customers were mad I sent business away. Not my problem. I'm sure he will reimburse his customer, yet treated me terribly. I told him I was writing this review and he told me to tell the whole story so I hope he sees this.

0yEnniCEO6WrgS4gSgv3hA.text: I absolutely love this place. The food is excellent as so is the service. The food is good quality and quantity for an excellent price!

mJq95gMxUmhOS9NIuC7H0A.text: I've been going to La Shish for years and the food is always amazing. Their hummus is silky smooth- and I always request extra garlic and green pepper sauce. You won't be disappointed.

6Om1m4N519zIRfysgVBtNg.text: Best Lebanese food in Charlotte hidden in a tiny strip mall on Sharon Amity near Albemarle Road. Great food can be ordered but the restaurant also has a buffet that is amazing! Food alternates every day and parking is very easy. This is a great spot that all foodies should check out.

RtwVTU-ShhqWahlVBZILYg.text: I appreciated all of the vegetarian friendly options on their menu! I went with the vegetarian combo and it was amazing. Comes with hummus, baba ganoosh, falafel, a salad, and grape leaves with rice and other items, then pita on the side. It was all excellent and quite a bit of food - enough for me to take leftovers home and I love leftovers.   The only thing that was a little frustrating was that when asked for a little taziki for a dipping sauce, I was told it would be quite a bit extra (not sure how much). Now I wasn't as frustrated when I saw that giant bowl they brought out.

rGoh2-ul8zWENIyavw6-bg.text: May be not the best representation of theirs. But my experience was terrible and i hate this place for the trouble i had from a staff of theirs. Others staffs and even other customers who were present at that time was extremely empathetic and kind. But this old man is evil.

GTV8mvYi750zULH6RKIBNA.text: I'm so glad this location had a buffet option. While I don't normally opt for buffets, I've had very little experience with Mediterranean food and the little experience I've had honestly left me with no desire to ever eat this type of food again. Luckily, my brother-in-law convinced me that I'd be doing myself a disservice if I didn't give this place a try. I tried everything on the buffet and there was not one thing I didn't enjoy. My favorites were cauliflower, a potatoe dish stuffed with ground meat (sorry don't know what it's called), the lentil rice and the Lebanon salad. The flavors were rich and the food gave you that good home cooked feel! The food hands down earns this place 4 stars on my book. I must mention that the service was almost non existent. We walked in and were told to grab a seat and enjoy the buffet. As first timers we were unaware that you have to go get your own drink from the refrigerated cooler. We finally figured that out after plate #2 when we were quite parched. There were also no labels on the buffet so guess that food was the game of the evening. I will eat at this restaurant again because the food was simply delicious even though I am not certain of what all I ate.

vaYMS91kZFCr9z7atgQAdQ.text: I've been going to "Shish," as I affectionately call it, since it opened. What most others have said is True. It is easily overlooked, mostly because it's in a tiny little strip mall between a barber shop and an Ethiopian grocery/restaurant. There isn't much in the way of ambiance, but I don't really feel it's necessary. You go for the food, not because it's nice to look at or a fun place to chill.   The owner is always welcoming and friendly, even when they're packed. And, they're packed more often than not.   I've had most things on the menu and all if it is pretty good. Though, sometimes it is better than others. I much prefer popping into Shish rather than some greasy fast food spot. The food is fresh, homemade, and tastes great. Some favorite repeats of mine: lamb kabob wrap, tabbouleh, falafel wrap, vegetarian combo, chicken shawarma, & kibbeh.   I will say that their desserts are just okay. If you want something better, check out Golden Bakery next door or the Halal Market across the street. Oh, but their coffee is pretty great.

LRxpu5vfd2X5UtbIitsS8g.text: Deeeelicious!!! Had the falafel and it was super good!! My friend had the daily special: hen, potatoes, rice, veggies. It was awesome, big portions too!!!

E5D2t_BgDAjN4hAvNI5P2g.text: So darn good. I get the lamb shanks every time. Huge pieces of meat dripping off the bone. They just expanded the restaurant so now there's a lot more room for dining.

isaJyANDMdaOf9EbvhNb5g.text: The food at this place is amazing!   We had the grilled lamb kabob platter,  Lebanon salad and the vegetarian combo which has hummus, grape leaves, baba ghannouj and falafel. The food is authentic, delicious and fresh, all at a very low price. If you're looking for great authentic Mediterranean food this is the place to visit!

oacMF10n-BqialM-uvgXYA.text: Location, sketchy. Food, phenomenal. This place is one of the defining reasons why I LOVE Mediterranean food. The spices, herbs, meat, EVERYTHING is incredibly fresh. I had quite the sampling of food so I did get a good idea of the beautiful things this place is capable of. Even with the large sampling the bill was quite reasonable.  If you're a fan of Mediterranean food or you just love great food this is a great place to get some of the freshest and most flavorful food you'll ever have.

kqNQmGBffTeBZ07UsWoIhw.text: i went here for the recent Taste of the World jaunt.    I've never eaten lamb before, but it was a huge piece on the bone, that the minute I put my fork on it, fell away from the bone beautifully!    I devoured it quickly and now I can't wait to go back to try some other kebab things!  The sauces were delicious!  I loved the Baba Ganoush (sp) as well!

ewEac9JQJLi7hnoAc65cDQ.text: Amazing delicious! Two lamb shanks combo! Never finished it in a single meal! Very clean! The stuffs are so kind! The guy with a red cap all the time is so shy and funny! BTW, you can't miss the jalapeno spicy sauce. It is spicy but very delicious! A special smell that can make you feel fresh and comfortable.

JHMLn-lN-aAROsuF3P8xLQ.text: Very good!  Authentic, cheap, and fast.  I could basically live off the lentil soup, and that's just a side item.  Check out the whole lamb shanks!

vBIAMrxbRHfRuXzDfHpyMA.text: I've been shish kabobed into this place .. amazing flavors, something new to me and the charcoal grill on the meats is awesome :)

KcV6_yoJehNESHMqIUskcg.text: I'm middle eastern and of course i can tell if a middle eastern restaurant is good or not..food here is really good! And staff members are very nice...will definitely come back here

g2ovDp5sV-fIEYLwaAAH-g.text: I've been wanting to write a review for this place but didn't get a chance until now.  I was visiting Charlotte, NC for a conference in November 2014.  I met the owner, very graceful and hospitable man, may God bless him and his family always!!!  He deserves 100 stars and I'm not just saying that out of no-where!!!   The service he provided was absolutely wonderful!  The food tasted great!!  I had ordered the full Cornish hen with rice and had substituted another side for hummus.  The portions were huge!!! I had also ordered some food to take with me on the next morning flight for my husband (chicken kabobs and other items) and the owner packed everything for me in very good packaging (for the flight).  My husband really enjoyed the meal the next night.  The food was great, the place was super clean (even the bathrooms), the prices were very reasonable (or even cheap compared to Bay Area) and the portions were huge.  On top of that, the service was very welcoming and hospitable.  What else can you ask for in a restaurant!!!   I wish we had such great tasting Arabic restaurants in the Bay Area.  If I ever get a chance to go back to Charlotte, I will definitely ask him the recipe for the most flavorful yellow rice I've tried in the whole world.  Thank you for providing such great food and great service to a hungry customer at close to 10pm at night.  God bless you!!!

xJUczHweViEwYMC7pAGgZw.text: The best mediterranean food I've tasted yet in Charlotte. We come here regularly to eat and the owner is pretty nice.  My favs: lentil soup, lamb shank, mixed kabob, yellow rice.

DDCM3DJpbfe4ll66UKGXGw.text: I just wish I had found this place sooner. Love it!  I have been starved for good Middle Eastern food in Charlotte.  This place is By Far the best that I have tried.  The price are extremely low and the quality is exceptionally high. The portions are large. How they can sell two lamb shanks for such a low price is beyond me.  You don't come here for the atmosphere.  You come here for the food.  But I did think that the diversity of the patrons was very interesting. I've probably eaten here 6 or so times now and every time I have been extremely impressed.   Just try La Shish Kabob.  You won't be disappointed.

lHQtaocygDztbE0bBPPp0w.text: Yelp reviews led us here while visiting Charlotte, and did not mislead.  We had a great buffet meal ... served on Friday, Saturday and Sunday from appx. 12:30 - 8:30. The owner was fabulous - lively and full of personality: staff was gracious and attentive.  Lots of meat and vegetarian options on the delicious buffet!  We weren't fans of the beef kofta, and do wish there'd been a dessert offering included.  My husband's favorite things were the lamb chops, and the baba ganoush (which had a distinct smoky flavor). I loved the flavorful tabbouleh, and there was a  grilled eggplant "salad" (not a hot dish) that I couldn't get enough of - delicious!  We got warm handshakes from the owner on the way out, and 2 repeat customers commented to us that this is the most authentic place in town.  We're already planning a return trip to Charlotte that will definitely include a visit to this hidden gem!

L5T_GHbPkUdq0mnzHj2ZyA.text: During an overnight stay in Charlotte, we stopped in at La Shish Kabob for dinner. Interesting restaurant, very warm/homely, with many choices of Mediterranean cuisine. The food that we ordered was generally good. There could be better communication when ordering food, however the food was freshly prepared and arrived fast. The wraps with fries receive an A-, as in pretty darn good.  The mixed grill was plentiful with a good amount of rice and meat selections.  However, I would have liked the meat to be less dry.   Customer service was generally good, very friendly people behind the counter.

BrUV3XCvBEWq9ijGU0IPeQ.text: Well done .. very generous portion.. 8 miles away and arrived warm .. even fries were great ..  And no additional charges for extra garlic and spice on the side  Will definitely order again

CiE419POGy3vymOIf3u7CQ.text: La Shish Kabab has been on my list to try but I feel like this visit wasn't a  good representation of them.   My visit was Easter Sunday. La Shish Kabab was open and was having a buffet. I decided not to do the buffet but to order off the menu. I got the NYC style Sharma plate. I got my nibblings a cheeseburger to share and my friend order the Cornish Hen plate. The whole ordering process was quite an ordeal and I was ready to go. I never felt like I knew exactly what was happening. I ordered at the counter then when I said it was for here I was directed to have a seat and told I could pay afterwards. No one helped us with drinks or silverware. It was kinda a free for all.     Once we got our food there were some slight issues. One my rice was cold and hard and needed massive amounts of the white sauce to make it edible. I requested some extra sauce and then I needed more but was told that it would cost 5.95 for more sauce. If you know me you know I hate paying for extra sauce when the entree is extremely dry. I would say that the dish overall was ok but it would have been better if it was fresh and hot. I hate to say this but I've had better off a food truck downtown.   The other issue was that they tried to exchange a half a hen for a Cornish hen. When it was brought to their attention there were excuses made and ultimately we had it taken back and removed from our check. But they decided that we would be still charged for the salad that came with the dinner. I was so ready to go and for the experience to be over that I just paid for the items and didn't make a stink.   I love Mediterranean food and this was not a good experience. I would like to say I would come back and give them another try but  I have found other restaurants that offer great food and service and so I don't see myself coming back anytime soon.   La Shish Kebab 3117-A N Sharon Amity Charlotte, NC 28205 Sunday April 21, 2019 12:30pm
