Photo of La Shish Kabob - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of La Shish Kabob - Charlotte, NC, United States. NYC Sharwma Meal

DMbFrsh7OZDRIIPe_Raj8Q.text: Hands down, they have the best feel-at-home interiors. Everything is clean and tidy. The number of options you could dine at this restaurant are numerous. First, They have a take out section with an easy to order numbered menus and on your face big pictures. Second, they have an ala-carte dine in options with a quick menu card. Lastly, they have a buffet option.  Highly satisfied with the ala-carte we had here last time, we decided to take the adventurous route and go for the buffet. It was a friday evening and had a look around the buffet before taking it up. The items were half full and not having any kind of experience with this kind of buffet, we decided to take it up anyway. The items were not clearly described let alone tagged! Being choosy meat eaters, it was bizarre experience to taste these items and decide whether to eat them. Even though they were kept on the hot plate, none of the items were warm. Surprising thing was, no one took care of the buffet bar. It was totally unattended. Most of the food items were either cold or stale. We filled our stomachs with the fresh fruits and musk melons. Finally the baklava dessert plate was empty and we reminded the waiter to refill it. He said he would check but never came back with an answer. And forgot to mention he was the only waiter running around trying to take care of all the tables. So even if you dine in, don't expected to be taken care.  Having a bad experience, we didn't want to behave rude and paid the costly 15.99$ per person buffet anyway. We gave our feedback that the food items were cold and our request to refill the baklava plate was never addressed. The guy bluntly replied they were out of baklava even though they had plates and plates of freshly baked dessert items just behind the counter. We expected an apology or some sorry for your bad experience dialogue but the guy never said anything and was quick to swipe our card. Having seen our annoying faces, he quickly threw a dessert box at us. We left immediately - we should not have taken the dessert box, but having paid a costly buffet price for stale food, we took it anyway.  Of course, they serve great ala-carte food and take out meals. But why keep the buffet option if you decide to abandon it and let food go stale without any refills. And the restaurant desperately needs more staff if they really care about their dine-in patrons. It was also a sudden revelation that the restaurant was on the expensive side for an entry level take out place. 12-16$ entrees and 1$ water bottles - forgot to mention, you won't be provided any water, you got to buy them!  The only way I see you can enjoy their great food is to order a take out and forget that you will be seeing a pretty hefty bill for a take out.

photos.caption: Photo of La Shish Kabob - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of La Shish Kabob - Charlotte, NC, United States. Minced Lamb Samosas
Photo of La Shish Kabob - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sharwarma wrap

feB1kJdeDydqFokEERZXiA.text: Being on Yelp's top 100 list, this was on our radar to visit. We had mixed feelings with our visit; the food was 5 stars but the service was just 1 star. However, I will still come back just because the food is that good.   While we got a friendly welcome from the staff as soon as we entered, that was the extent of the customer service. After we found our own table no one ever came to check up on us. Little did I know I had to grab my own drink from one of the fridges at the front of the restaurant.   Being the weekend you can order directly from the menu or choose the buffet. I opted for the buffet so I could try a bit of everything. I am glad I did. I have no negative comments on any of the food. Everything was flavorful and tasty.  My favorites dishes were eggplant, lamb, and cauliflower. Nothing was labeled so I have no idea what anything was called.  I am hoping that we just caught the staff on an off day but either way the food alone is worth the visit.

photos.caption: Photo of La Shish Kabob - Charlotte, NC, United States. Buffet sampling: lamb, chicken, rice &amp; lentils, eggplant, cauliflower and salad
Photo of La Shish Kabob - Charlotte, NC, United States. Dessert

MMFUsBlIK2ZAgHtgZMydgw.text: Very good food. It has a lot of Mediterranean foods and good apps like Hummus & Tabbouleh which go well with falafel and kabobs.

0d3iLRYGTYNKjEubG4STPQ.text: Wow this place is open until midnight. Happened to visit randomly since this was the place that was open late night! We ordered to-go. Very good portion for the price. They do have good sitting arrangement as well. It was around 10pm when we placed our order and food was ready in 15 mins. We got a complimentary dessert! I will go again for the chicken Shwarma.

photos.caption: Photo of La Shish Kabob - Charlotte, NC, United States. Baba ganoush on the side comes with pita bread.
Photo of La Shish Kabob - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken kabob over rice
Photo of La Shish Kabob - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken shwarma - with rice and salad

cS3dcJgdIqTK9cSGMfs0eQ.text: Growing up near Detroit, I was raised on good middle eastern food. Whether it was at a friends house or a local restaurant, shawarma was served like bbq is in the south. La Shish is hands down the best Lebanese food in Charlotte. And now they have a buffet!! Just when you thought your favorite spot couldn't get any better. Lamb, chicken, beef, falafel, fresh pita and all our favorite sides like hummus, tabouli, fattoush and rice. They even have couple soups going. Check it out! And don't forget your to go order on the way out!

photos.caption: Photo of La Shish Kabob - Charlotte, NC, United States. Played buffet meal.
Photo of La Shish Kabob - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of La Shish Kabob - Charlotte, NC, United States. Dining room

2QzSNKtjIMKpOsgIN9THoA.text: Love this restaurant. My husband and I discovered this place before it got nearly as big. It was our little spot. The owner and his family are amazing people! The staff is friendly and the food is AMAZING!  We love them and will always find time to take the drive from fort mill! Well worth it!

vgCEHmDKhYI_o2jKsmtxDw.text: The best Middle Eastern/Mediterranean cuisine in Charlotte - no - in all of North Carolina. We stumbled upon this place one afternoon when our regular spot was closed. When we initially arrived, I was a tad skeptical; the restaurant was in a run down shopping mall, but since we had driven all the way there, we decided to give it a shot. We ended up going for the buffet, which was all-you-can-eat for $15. Every single item in the buffet was incredible. The tabouli was fresh, the hummus was full of flavor, and the bread was warm, straight out of the oven. The star of the entire meal, however, was the lamb. This dish alone would have been worth the $15, but considering it was part of a buffet, it is the bargain of the century. The meat quite literally fell off the bone, was incredibly moist, and absolutely packed with flavor. In addition, the owner knows us by name after only 3 visits, and is both very attentive and welcoming. La Shish Kabob has quickly become one of our favorites!!  Also if you get the chance, their COFFEE is out of this world. Thick, sludgey, and PACKS A PUNNNNCH.

T-WaGiGSBtuJFXpGcFZVXA.text: Come here to lunch. Was a good place, great food and good service.  I got NY style shawarma chicken with rice. it was very quick than I expected. The salad and vegetable was fresh. Good flavor

i0RxUdPDf5X3b3e5cDlkLQ.text: Not to be confused with Ny Shish, Chi Shish, Hou Shish, or even Sf Shish, this is the Los Angeleno version of this excellent Middle Eastern food spot.  Excellent babaganoush and some great dishes here. A really good example of yummy Middle Eastern food and although service can be a little gruff and questionable, I still recommend coming here. There were some really spectacular girls in here the day I was here as well. I was very happy they were open on Thanksgiving because the last several places I tried were not.

photos.caption: Photo of La Shish Kabob - Charlotte, NC, United States. introducing my father. Baba Ghanoush.
Photo of La Shish Kabob - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shhhhhhhh. (ish)
Photo of La Shish Kabob - Charlotte, NC, United States. La Not Spanish

z_GNpd6XaFJknSq9rdT82g.text: Woah! What a terrible experience. The food was so dry and bland. Their was a man behind the counter with long beard and hair and wasn't wearing a hair net or anything, he also kept touching his mouth (I believe he was the manager). The table we sat at wasn't clean and the place looked like it hadn't been dusted or wiped down. I believe the way the manager compensates for the low quality or grade food is through the quantities. Their platters were so oily and greasy. We got the lamb shank and the mixed grill. Not going back.

iHxaxxxoZ_Gid1-CJHjbMA.text: Man I stumbled into this hidden gem today and was blown away. The food is amazing and they had a buffet when we showed up. My two favorite items was the falafel that was fried to perfection and stewed okra in a tomato sauce. They also had different sauces such as a hummus and yogurt sauce with salads. I must say this was a great experience and would recommend it to anyone who loves middle eastern food.

vWHnbwfUVxTxwZTGd2wPuA.text: We will definitely be back!  It's a bit of a trek since we live in Huntersville but worth it I would say.    Me and the hubster both ordered the hummus and lamb shank meal with rice.  Everything was a musical melody on our taste buds.  LOL  The hummus was rich and just garlicky enough to not be overpowering!  We had the lentil soup as our other side and it was thick hearty and full of flavor.  My hubby added the spicey red sauce to kick his up a notch but I am not a fan of hot stuff so I passed.   The real star was the lamb shank meal.  While simple it was melt in your mouth good.  I am always amazed at how if you use the right spices and cook food properly it should be able to be consumed with no salt/pepper or additional seasonings and I would say this is True with La Shish Kabob.  The place itself is unassuming and easy to miss if you are not looking for it but the food and taste certainly make up for any lack of ambiance.    My hubby goes to the Halal store across the street when he prepares his curry goat at home.  :)  We finished it off with rice pudding and it was equally pleasing! Not too sweet but sweet enough with warm earthy spices that made me smile.    We are having fun discovering new eating spots and this will be in the rotation for sure.

Wa4jY9TucQKSkPy_5Piqpw.text: Walking into this place takes you to another world far away where all your senses are awakened by the visual decor of Arabic writing, by the pungent smell of spices and the sounds of a different culture. The owner, he must be, was standing behind the cash register and was doing some fast talking in Arabic to a customer with his hands and arms all up in the air. Judging by the way the conversation was going, it looked like the owner wanted to comp the meal and then they hugged before the customer left with his food . I looked up at the pictures with numbers to help making ordering the food a little easier. There were displayed cases with raw marinated skewered meat so that you can see how fresh everything was. I ordered the veggie platter, some falafels, and lamb shanks. On some square tables located by the register were some cookies both sweet and savory that looked yummy so I bought some pastries with spinach filling. The whole time I was trying to order the owner was very helpful and friendly. He even gave me some almond and honey cookies that were delicious. I had everything to go and was so excited and couldn't wait to taste it. The veggie platter was delicious with some hummus, baba ghanoush, some salad, and falafels. These falafels were soft and I really preferred them crispy. The lamb shanks were a little gamy for my taste but pretty good if you like lamb. I would give this place another try but next time I'll try the chicken gyro. Did I mention the stuffed grape leaves? Those were the best ones I have had in a while!!

9Kl9NwLRY77yhZIFGA7beA.text: Authentic, fresh food from Jerusalem. The hummus, falafel, and lamb shank are so flavorful. The owner is such a great guy! Stop by and support a local business.

photos.caption: Photo of La Shish Kabob - Charlotte, NC, United States

50_btPJ4d_mpLETKzo2Q3g.text: Always great food great prices great energy! Love coming here for the amazing food and culture! This place is always busy and thats always a sign of a good place to eat! Friendly staff and speedy service!

photos.caption: Photo of La Shish Kabob - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Shawerma Plate
Photo of La Shish Kabob - Charlotte, NC, United States. Baba Ghannouj Dip
Photo of La Shish Kabob - Charlotte, NC, United States. 6 Pieces Grape Leaves

2K1o79wue4vyT4xRWVZwOg.text: Let's be straight here. The place doesn't look like much. The mall it is in doesn't look great, and the logo looks like some elementary school kids - albeit talented ones - scribbled it on the brick. But if you give it a chance, you will find that it is worth a stop.  On the inside, the service is second-to-none, and even on your first visit you are treated like family. Which is not to say the family that you don't want around (though if you act that way and they kick you out, it's your fault, so consider yourself warned). No, they are warmly welcoming and help you through the menu of options, which can certainly seem challenging if this is your first time.  When you get to the food, it's almost like an old diner, with an open kitchen and that's great but it also means there aren't a lot of tables - a better option may be to take the food to go - only then it would not be hot off the grill, so you can decide the best course of action for your own needs.  If you find a spot, sit down and dig into it right away so you get some of the goodness when it is fresh, and it's definitely a great spot to give a shot, elementary logo and all.

6c1PoNFMGAheM-vY89H0-A.text: I am a picky Mediterranean/ Arab food diner, but I gotta say that some of their selections are just off the hook! i.e. their chicken and beef kabob skewers over the yellow rice, lentil soup, cucumber and tomato salad. And the price you pay for the portion you get is a steal!   Having that said, I like the yellow rice more than their orange (or what they call the "special" rice), and I think the yellow rice should actually be the special rice, but oh well, whatever floats their boat.   The dessert is okay, but I don't really come here for dessert. Their food is just soooo filling for me, and it just makes my day.  ***A tip for everyone: I have noticed that if you take out and taking a long drive home, the food won't taste as great (but still decently good) as it originally was piping hot because some selections of the food may dry up. But this is not the owner's or the restaurant's fault, it's just common sense for some foods when you take out.   The ambiance/ aesthetics of this place are not great, but it's a small fast food place almost, and I really just go there for a delicious and filling meal.   Staff is friendly but not overly. The guy who owns the place has long red hair and does look like he is straight out of the Hobbit, but the only thing is he is not too friendly when there is a rush.

jUKb9I-45NZoKz5tMqVxbQ.text: Visited couple weeks ago on Thursday after early voting. All positive reviews for this establishment!! Ordered many dishes and all were beyond great. Owner is super nice and friendly and went out of his way to satisfy us, he knew it was our 1st visit. So glad I chose to come here rather than other Mediterranean establishments in Charlotte. Can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of La Shish Kabob - Charlotte, NC, United States

Ca_PexCqXNOhMiFE4alTEA.text: Hello, new found "one of my favorite" restaurants. My wallet thanks you, as well as my belly and tastebuds. I'm tempted to go there for lunch a second day in a row...it was that tasty!  If you're looking for a casual place with authentic food, you'll want to check out  La Shish Kabob! It has a little bit of Middle Eastern decor inside, but you don't go for the ambiance...you go for the delicious cuisine!   To start, we got the veggie combo: hummus, baba ganoush, and grape leaves. It comes with fresh sliced pita bread. Really after eating that plate, we were practically full. Next came our sandwiches: falafel and a chicken shawarma. The falafel was perfect! Crispy on the outside, but soft on the inside and seasoned to perfection. Halfway through the sandwich I knew I was stuffed, but my mouth didn't want to stop eating because of the flavor. For dessert we shared one baklava. It was pretty good. I prefer it made with pistachios, but this type was made with walnuts or pecans.  There are approximately 5 tables, but if you don't want to stay, plenty of people were ordering "to go." This place was steady during lunch. One of the best things about this place, besides the quality of the food, is the price...we left under $20 including tip!   We will definitely return...probably as early as today...see you there!

WlMzl0fq6rNxn4w1wGnuSg.text: You might as well 'roll up' (insert Big Pimpin' here) because when you're done, you will need to be rolled out. Made the trek south for a day in the QC, specifically b/c I was needing some ethnic food to satisfy an itch. Based on all the great reviews, THIS was my go-to, must try spot.   Hubs and I took the ankle biters and enjoyed the following:  Appetizer Sampler, $6.99, choice of three apps. We selected the hummus, fallafel and dolmas Kgrape leaves.) All were very good. The fresh pita is the best I've had since Idunnowhen.   Various imported drinks, all well priced and really good.  Lamb Shank special, $9.99, with choice of side and soup/salad. Where the heck can you get lamb shank for under $10bucks????????? Hubs enjoyed this, as did the one year old ankle biter. Salad is light and fresh, served w/a light, lemon-y house made dressing.  Chicken Kabob entree, $7.99, w/choice of side and soup/salad. Looked, smelled and tasted like the food that fed my belly and soul as a kid growing up surrounded by Greeks, Turks and Armenians. Delicious.   Izzat, the owner, was very friendly, quick to reccomend and clearly has a lot of experience in the industry. The set-up is simple and a bit shabby, but you are there to feast and that you do. You are served on platters (PLATTERS!!!!) and will most definitely have more than enough to take home. The four of us devoured our food. They musta thought we hadn't eaten for days. Thank gawd many eastern cultures use their bread (pita) as a utensil - I didn't look like a *total* barbarian.   So why not four stars? One major point: the owner smoked while standing at the counter, next to our table....in the restaurant....which is illegal...and I was with two asthmatics....and I loathe cigarette smoke. My other nitpick: my food was delicious but the rice was barely warm. That said, we had enough really good food to easily feed six people (though with just four we can delight in leftovers) for $32 smackers! NICE!

photos.caption: Photo of La Shish Kabob - Charlotte, NC, United States. Izzat, the owner in the background. This cooler houses the various cold salads/dips and the kabobs that are ready to go.
Photo of La Shish Kabob - Charlotte, NC, United States. This Isreali/Palestinian soda is like candy in a can. Sooooo sweet!
Photo of La Shish Kabob - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lamb Shank Special. $9.99 w/choice of side and soup or salad. TONS of delicious food.

Lyhc6pqtcmu8uAxrMy9Spw.text: I'm a huge fan of Middle Eastern food, and La Shish Kebob is pretty good.  I have to warn you - La Shish Kebob is not in the nicest strip mall and the restaurant itself is extremely small.  But please, don't let their location or interior deter you from giving them a try.   We were enthusiastically greeted by the owner and led to our table.  We ordered the 8-piece falafel platter as our appetizer.  For dinner, I ordered the vegetarian combo (with hommos, baba ghannouj and yalanji), and my hubby ordered the mixed grill kabob (with lamb, chicken, and beef).  I also ordered the special rice for $1 on the side.  Every single thing we ordered was absolutely delicious.  My only complaint was with how they delivered our food.  Since my vegetarian plate did not need to be cooked, it was delivered first and placed in the center of the table.  I thought - what, this is my dinner, right?  So, my hubby and I ended up sharing it while we waited for the falafel and his kabobs to arrive. The falafel plate was huge, outstanding in flavor, and lighter in texture than we are accustomed to (in a good way). We also shared my hubby's meat plate when it arrived, and it ended up being my favorite - the meat was really tender and juicy.  Frankly, I have never had chicken or lamb this delicious before.    The owner stopped by several times to see how we were doing, and even gave my hubby a special hot sauce that he just loved.  We could tell he took great pride in his place.  I'm only dropping a star because on subsequent visits, they were busier, and so the service suffered.  It's also a tiny place inside, and hard to enjoy your meal when it's really busy.

Bpns4OOn4RAEnEd94osD2A.text: Amazing food. We ordered catering for a very large dinner party (70 people), and everyone was raving about the food. It took a while to negotiate our order and the menu, but they provided a fair price, and prompt delivery service. The baklava arrived warm! Highly recommend La Shish Kabob for any catering services. Will definitely visit the restaurant soon. Also, the portions are very large, so if ordering for catering, plan to have plenty of left overs.

photos.caption: Photo of La Shish Kabob - Charlotte, NC, United States. Catering from La Shish Kabob
Photo of La Shish Kabob - Charlotte, NC, United States. Catering from La Shish Kabob

gy55kD7CLUkexvdXsduHag.text: Came here for lunch while on a business trip. Got the chicken shwarama plate and it was outstanding. Chicken was flavored well and they give lots of it. Really liked their garlic sauce as well. Had enough for lunch and dinner. Owner is a really nice guy as well. Not the biggest place, but they serve good food.

c_e41cDA52UOIaPnI_M1fw.text: If you're looking some pretty good food, La Shish is your place!  The food here is delicious and priced very well. The portions are large, so sharing is definitely an option (that is if you can pull yourself away from your yummy dish).  The restaurant is cozy with a really friendly manager, he's very helpful and kind. I've been here a few times, and I think I finally have a favorite. Shwarma's are great, and the homemade hummus is something I could eat by the spoonful O_o !!!   I love getting the 3 Kabob plate which comes with lamb, chicken, and kafta. KAFTA KAFTA, so so so yummy. I mean I pretty much ate all of that first, then the lamb, followed by whatever chicken I could fit into my belly. This is a good choice if you want to share or try a few different things.   The food here is always on point and I've never had a bad experience. I'm a huge fan of La Shish Kabob, and will be back soon.

hUYj_n6bS_pJ9iFYOveZGw.text: always delicious. super friendly service. great to see a restaurant expand and be a cultural hub. gotta get me some garlic mayo and falafel.

uGF1kffHg0a7_0LSYmqoUA.text: This place is amazing! The owner is super nice and I believe many members of his family work here too. The food is so delicious!  Lamb Shania and shawerma with humus. You can't go wrong.

z4q0BnTrmHN6eYfQSLw7Rg.text: I never leave reviews, but I had to this time!  We just moved to Charlotte from Northern VA, and I was skeptical of finding good middle eastern food that rivaled our local favorites back home. I am pleased to say this one was even better.  The location was a little out of the way for us and due to traffic, we almost turned around, but I'm so glad we didn't.  The owner and staff was very friendly and the prices are so affordable! I got the chicken shawarma platter and my husband got the mixed grill platter (lamp, beef, chicken). I tend to find the meat in most middle eastern dishes, while flavorful, is often a bit dry and I couldn't believe how tender everything was! The salad that came with is was so good and fresh, and the flavors were amazing. Great sauces too.  We will definitely be coming back, as I'm not sure I will be trying any other places after finding this one!

p5lxsG_KhiKmLSFLYlOEwg.text: I come down to Charlotte often to visit family and friends. LA shish kabob is the first place I make sure to hit up before anything else!  I travel all around the states and I havnt tasted food so authentic and tasty! Thanks LA shish kabob for always sending me home so satisfied!! Can't wait to come back!

LZDTDKtwX1Kspa7wFh8Csg.text: The food was so good!!! It was fresh,  seasoned great and piping !!!!Service was ok but the food......GREAT!

uIQTDAa6EvWU-GTyTIoOJA.text: Fantastic service!!!  The owner is waiting on you with more enthusiasm and friendliness than you could imagine.  OPEN Kitchen is a big plus!  Huge Dessert display in Dessert Fridge!   The flavor of everything was good.  If you like mild and I don't mean spicy hot or mild, though nothing was spicy hot either.  The Turkish Coffee was A-OK.  Lamb Shank, was super tender fell off the bone and had a nice flavor, the Tabouleh, Baklava, Special Rice, were way too plain.  The Beef Shish Kabob was the only item that had a zing to it and I would give it a 3.5 yelp stars, everything else I got was 3 stars or less.   Everything was much milder than I'm used to, which I say because some probably prefer it this mild.

photos.caption: Photo of La Shish Kabob - Charlotte, NC, United States. Turkish Coffee
Photo of La Shish Kabob - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lamb Shank with Special Rice
Photo of La Shish Kabob - Charlotte, NC, United States

upg2KPUgoy2JogXF7njE5Q.text: Food was ok. Service was bad. I understand that it is self service, but the man bussing the table was not friendly at all.  I merely asked for a take out box.  I had never been there before.  He pointed and said, "they are over there, you get it". I won't be returning.  I have been searching for a good middle eastern restaurant. The search continues.

-CKhBjVTfbMBkePd6pHQwQ.text: It's open until midnight.  That alone makes me happy, but there is a lot to this little place other than keeping convenient hours. Maybe I'm hungry at 11 cause I didn't get a chance to eat earlier & don't feel like a high fructose corn patty from MickeyD's or some other fried abortion swimming in grease. Too harsh, I love bar food and late night Chinese, but sometimes I need something else that's open late besides, fast food or a Denny's. Something I won't completely regret eating.  Too much ranting about the inconsequential...again.  La Shish is a hole in the wall Mom & Pop establishment. There's no pretension, no linens, no giggling strumpets on dates with tall doofuses, just solid Middle Eastern food at reasonable prices. The simplest things are always the best. They serve up well seasoned grilled lamb, chicken and beef kabobs. Their fries are a meh minus, but I feel like an infidel getting them here anyway. Then there's my favorite refrain for any restaurant: the food is not oily or greasy.  As far as I know (which is not much), this could be the best shawarma and definitely the best tahini sauce in Charlotte. The "shawarma wrap" is not unlike the donner kebabs that are ubiquitous in many European countries that serve as their version of fast food, late night drunk munchie snack and hangover placebo. Fucking delicious. And definitely better tasting than fast food with REAL meat and REAL vegetables. I mean, they even cut the meat off of that big thing, you know, that big thing.  Fairly vegetarian friendly; I like a good falafel every now and again & they have one.  "Okay my friend" is what the owner behind the counter always says when your food is ready. This is a quickie joint, not a Michelin star place, so expect the service to be "authentic" as well.

WV8qaHhwO6AFtcZWFM5GJQ.text: The owner of this restaurant looks exactly like Gimli from Lord of the Rings, with his long red hair and beard, and he is such an awesome guy!  My family and I eat here regularly and he's always quick to greet us with a grin and a handshake.  It's a real family business, his daughters also work there. The food comes in generous portions at great prices.  I am pretty much addicted to their chicken shwarma dinner with veggie rice, but the falafel is amazing too.  The first time I ate there I told the owner I would definitely be back... he looked at me and said "Praise Allah for you my friend!"  Praise Allah indeed and go eat at La Shish Kebab!

kfxCwgw-bvzJRyebOzAyWw.text: Just for the record absolutely hands-down the best middle Eastern cuisine I've ever had still to date ! Me and a buddy AJ and his family went here couple years ago now ...damn good food omg it's really amazing.. Yes there is other places in town but after revisiting this place again it's just better I think. You have to check out the Kibbeh, Falafel, Chicken Shawarma, Kafta Kabobs....!!  They also have a few desserts but my favorite is Baklava. If your a coffee person try the real deal Turkish coffee .....You won't regret it you'll thank me later ...enjoy!!!!

vpIrLiB034bCL3JnRs6ijw.text: This place is amazing.  The food is made fresh every day, and I have never had better falafel or hummus, anywhere.  I get the falafel wrap once or sometimes twice a week, and ask them to add their homemade green hot "sauce" which is made with jalapenos, lemon juice and garlic. Delicious!  It's also great mixed into hummus.  Also, I don't know what kind of incredible Lebanese pickles they put in the falafel wrap but I'd buy a whole container of them if I could!  I took a variety of treats to a recent NASCAR race for tailgating and my friends were blown away by how delicious everything is.  I really can't say enough wonderful things about La Shish Kabob.  Unlike so many Mediterranean places, everything is FRESH and homemade, and that makes all the difference in the world!!!

S38CSiZb2Y7vCAKm1Xa7hQ.text: The food here is spectacular and an amazing bargain. The portions are so huge I ended up packing over half of it up to take home. The restaurant is small, clean and by no means fancy with friendly people there to help you (the best kind of place for me). The proprietor was very helpful when we asked questions and when he took the lid off his braised lamb shanks I'm fairly certain my eyes rolled back into my head. I posted a picture of the refrigerator case where the kabobs and salads are, which you can see is all very fresh and ready to go. I only wish I'd taken a picture of the rotisserie, but once the food came out I had a one-track mind.   The baba ghannouj is absolutely amazing. The eggplant is cooked on the grill so you get far more smoky flavor than you ordinarily get in it. Admittedly we didn't leave a whole lot of it to bring home since it came to the table with hot flat bread and we pounced on it like a pack of hungry wolves, so I had to get another order to go. You know... for medicinal purposes.. :)  The lamb kabob was very tender, even though it was slightly overcooked for my taste (which actually says quite a lot since lamb is usually not tender if overcooked). The spiced rice was very delicious and probably way too much of it but I won't complain since that means more delicious leftovers. In general their 'side dishes' are not side portions - if you have soup you get a whole bowl, not a cup, and the rice seems almost bottomless. And as long as we're on the subject of their soup, the lentil soup is absolutely delicious - perfectly seasoned and while we had it on a warm June day I could definitely see a bowl of this stuff setting the world back to right on a cold winter day. The side salad was very crisp and fresh with chopped lettuce, tomatoes and cucumber laced with parsley and mint. It arrives undressed and you drizzle it with the lemon juice at the table, it hits a whole lot of right spots on a hot day.  ***** 3/26/2014 ***** Move forward and after MANY visits this wonderful find still rates a solid 5 stars and then some!   I've been back several times and had various items on the menu. Every one of them amazing. And remember my comment on my lamb being slightly overdone? Ya, forget that... the owner remembers me from the first time I brought this up, and ALWAYS remembers exactly how I like my lamb cooked. That personal touch is what pushes this place WAY over 5 stars for me. Plus have you seen the sanitation rating???? How many perfect scores do you see these days.. but it doesn't surprise me. This restaurant is meticulously clean. Not just up front either - if you peek back into the kitchens you can see they are also very clean and well organized.

photos.caption: Photo of La Shish Kabob - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chilled case of salads and foods ready to go. Spotlessly clean and all very fresh.
Photo of La Shish Kabob - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of La Shish Kabob - Charlotte, NC, United States

HQ-fziJSzwy0JkP4JKhZIQ.text: Four stars +  A year and over three dozen meals later I'm raising its rating. No, not everything is perfect, that doesn't happen anywhere but the food consistently more flavorful than it has right to be for a falafel joint - I suspect the owner is a foodie himself.   Usually with Arabic food I'm not drawn to meat dishes primarily, La Shish being the exception. I really like the Adana kabob, the mixed grill with special rice is a meat eater delight, even the chicken shwarma made me go like Larry David : "don't know what the Palestinian did with the chicken but it's out of this world!" Well, no it's not but it's really really good.   I recommend sharing a Foul Madamas appetizer, the taste always bring a smile to my face. I usually take home a container of their humus, priced like supermarket crap but so much better.  One thing: made without preservatives so you really want to eat within a few days.    The local Muslim community fully supports the restaurant  and it does a brisk business (Friday after prayer is a zoo in there!) but in spite of the many positive reviews I rarely if ever saw fellow gringos or gringas eating there.   We've never felt anything less than 110% safe eating there ourselves, but I did hear otherwise from locals so I'll end with this caveat: For adventure tourists only !   Not recommended for the tour bus or all inclusive cruise crowd.  8^P

S6WfXT9sS-o5K2GIJ-6VaA.text: La Shish Kabob is not going to win any awards for decor or atmosphere, but the food is good and solid.  The owner is very helpful if you ask for suggestions or if you want something made special.    I knew that I had to try the falafel since I had read on other reviews that their falafel is really good.  So, I ordered a falafel wrap and a bowl of lentil soup.   Both were very solid, but not better than what I can get at the Kabob Grill in Stonecrest.  However, the pricing at La Shish Kabob is much cheaper.   So, if you are looking for good solid food at great prices, I would definitley recommend La Shish Kabob

dTGNhg2ocpiAz8WX_umomw.text: That place used to have very good food but not really good customer service.. But that last time I was there, the food was very bad and a very bad customer service.. No napkins on the table... They just have a sink to wash your hands before and after you eat.. But hey! You still have to find your own trash can to throw away the paper towels because they don't have one

r9aHnFe0H-0TK2lSxFt7-g.text: Food looks smells and tastes great. The service is great, and the prices are great. The portions are great. And for some reason this place reminds me of living in NYC. Anyway, I've been to this place 3 times already in the past 2 weeks. It's now my go-to for lunch on days i work from home. So far I've tried the lamb philly, the fries, lamb shank, yellow rice, plantain soup, and felafel.

CrBDuB18o77vUSMZnsQLBw.text: Very friendly service and the lamb wrap was fantastic.

_jJY_hyS9JJ620ngvl3m4w.text: Visited this past Friday evening with my husband and 4 yr old son. We were welcomed and the menu vs the buffet was explained.  My dad had recommended the lamb shank, which I ordered, and my husband decided on the chicken kabobs.  I would have given this place a 5 star review for my lamb shank.  It was fork tender and packed full of flavor.  My son and I devoured it, yes my 4 yr old son loves lamb :)  My husband's dish, on the other hand, was missing the vegetables and the chicken was bland.  No strong flavor or marinade.  It was a disappointment.  We should have asked about the vegetables but being new to the place, we decided against it.  Also, the falafel was delicious too.  I will definitely go back but not sure if I can convince my husband to.  All in all, have the lamb!

aaiNgWHa0kxg5tZAkz2lsQ.text: By far the BEST middle eastern restaurant around!!!! I have turned everyone I know to La Shish and they become regulars soon after! The owner and his daughter are the best also! Everyone that works there has been for years! They must be doing something right (by that I mean EVERYTHING right:-)

A-D9CfqPWrNdXl5IGuqyjg.text: I love everything about this place. The lentil soup is good and so are the lamb gyros. Can't wait to go for the buffet.

lBOhGrn8RdThjsjxw95iuw.text: I love this place. The owner is really nice and the food is awesome. They are super clean and it's always fresh. It's food made with love. They have a selection of meats and vegetarian dishes as well. I go every week and never have anything but an awesome experience.

photos.caption: Photo of La Shish Kabob - Charlotte, NC, United States. Veg combo.
Photo of La Shish Kabob - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bread
Photo of La Shish Kabob - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Swarma

xCSxjSwNJr5bvZxu_AUR_A.text: I absolutely love, love, love.... I cannot emphasize how much I love this place!   The food is amazing & always fresh. The owner is awesome & will literally know each of his patrons by name.    When I call just the sound of my voice he'll greet me by name & read off my order based off of memory. I always order the Greek salad & skewers of chicken. It's absolutely delish. Now try that w/ the tahini (garlic sauce) & you will be in Food heaven.   Great good. Great service. All around nice spot! I'm a huge foodie & would recommend this to any & everyone.

Sz3EmUEsp-rnHcuYzzHYGw.text: This is my favorite Middle Eastern restaurant, great, authentic food, great service, friendly proprietor, great value.  Love eating here or getting to go.  Everything is good.  What more can I say?

pzMqMSo9effzY3xGCiFsIA.text: Talk about a hidden gem!! My weekends are not complete until I have had at least one meal from La Shish... it's usually a Sunday afternoon takeout. Basmati rice so perfectly cooked, to go with the perfectly seasoned chicken kabobs (the lamb kabobs are good too, I'm just a bigger fan of the chicken ones)  Warm pita bread with fresh falafels, topped with hummus, fries and garlic dip on the side. It doesn't get any better than this. In my experience, the food has always been fresh and flavorful, and the portions are big! Really great value for your money. There's something so wonderful about food that's simple, affordable & downright delicious - For complete soul, palette & pocket satisfaction - check out La Shish!

F4pfgFoQTNsq3zpXIdYoPQ.text: I don't come here often, I honestly don't find it very tasty, it's ok-ish, but when I have a hankering for Falafel and my favorite Mediterranean food restaurant is closed, well then, you gotta settle. I am not saying it's dreadful, no it's decent, they could do with tasting what they cook more often. I have found the food to be either over seasoned or bland-ish. Overall, I will come back because, I love falafel. Oh I do enjoy their red lentil soup, much! Sadly, they do not carry it often.

aXHlbKp2qijT-CNeokMUmw.text: I have lunch here 4 of the past 5 days. Only missed four because I was not in the area. Great authentic food, awesome atmosphere, and the staff is amazing! Next week I am shooting for 5/5 lunches there. :):)

photos.caption: Photo of La Shish Kabob - Charlotte, NC, United States

VMQ3gtmJahwfUqUQU434sQ.text: Inspired by multiple viewings of The Avengers back in the summer, my husband and I decided we really wanted to try shawarma. Although we'd never had it, Tony Stark's obsession and the ensuing post-credits scene were enough to spark our own shawarma craze. We were driving past La Shish Kabob one day and I noticed the neon sign indicating our quest could find its resolution there. I remembered reading many glowing reviews of the place here on Yelp. Within a day or so we had found our shawarma salvation, and it's less than a five-minute drive from home.  This unassuming hole in the wall is cramped and chaotic, but it is home to some of the best Middle Eastern food in town. Don't let the lack of fancy atmosphere steer you away from what could be your new favorite joint.  We now eat here or get takeaway at least two or three times a month. Yes, the shawarma is outstanding. Their falafel is the best I've ever had and the hummus is high up there, too. As a lifelong dolmas aficionado, I have to say theirs are the best I've had since I was a kid and visited an Egyptian family that my dad knew. My husband and I love to get the appetizer plate, always with hummus and dolmas. Everything we've tried has been incredible.

k1X_SOvKee79JHB3W9KG7g.text: Great moist flavorful shawarma .  Rice is a little oily but good.  Baba ghanoush was devine.  The tomatoe & cucumber salad was minty and fresh.

photos.caption: Photo of La Shish Kabob - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shawuarma to go

CstW2RShefRZsx_or9uHsQ.text: Terrible terrible terrible restaurant. The quality of food is really bad. The service is not good at all, they don't even bring you a drink.

_q9Is98sXIV5mDXiclRtcg.text: I finally tried this place out with a girl friend and brought my husband later the same week. It far exceeded my expectations! I have been able to try a few things on the menu now and everything has been delicious. Get anything with lamb and you'll be pleased :)

X0C9g-K7gFkFo7_0R5uqpg.text: Decent food rice was real dry. Pieces of chicken where real bland maybe just not the best dish to try. It was the chicken kabobs with rice and salad

photos.caption: Photo of La Shish Kabob - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Kabob

MrycpIzS-y69KvFuUTXEDQ.text: Love, love, love La Shish Kabob! Food is delicious and the atmosphere is a hoot. Highly recommend!

JiIbIuLC_fTMtHmFkKxwVQ.text: Love this place! You're gonna walk in and be like what in the world.. I know because that was me. Middle eastern is in my blood so finding a good middle eastern place can be tricky. This place is great. I recommend the Kafta, Hummus, Mixed grill, tabouli, and for desert make sure you get Kenfi! So good!

EHOGsP1ePKDCQ9uBAGh_Ig.text: Wholly crap, I am kicking myself for taking so long to find and check out this place. Long have I been starved and roaming the streets of Charlotte for a middle eastern and/or Mediterranean eatery like La Shish Kabob.  Between the fact that it's not in the best part of town and that Sharon Amity is a construction zone at the moment may dissuade you from checking it out, but you will thank me if you do. It's nothing fancy to look at from the outside or inside, but there  are a few tables both in both areas. Otherwise it's basically like a really small deli type shop with a register and a display case and open kitchen area. While they have a full menu of middle eastern and Mediterranean delicacies, I have only had the Schwarma meal on both of my visits. The wife has tried the falafel and veggie plate I believe. The garlic sauce that comes with the Schwarma is amazing and the spices in the chicken are spot on. I really need to force myself to try something else. We sat down inside on our second visit and the smells from the plates on the other tables making me hungry all over again.  Many return visits to come and eventually, I will make it through the whole menu.

photos.caption: Photo of La Shish Kabob - Charlotte, NC, United States. Schwarma meal with 2 sandwiches, fries and garlic sauce. Also a side of fresh tabbouleh.

fcBh47dGQd_wrfeMe6cFdw.text: I have been to this place for more than 5 times. Every time I have found the food to be fresh and tasty. The mixed grilled kebabs with a side soup and salad is my favorite.

q-TOxk50DqxnF0YGi7D5JQ.text: Three of us were in East Charlotte and decided to try this place out. I had the gyro with fries and my two friends had the chicken shawarma with fries and the grilled beef kabob with lentil soup and rice.   The grilled beef kabob was the tastiest. Probably about 12 small pieces of beef on a plateful of rice. He said the creamy lentil soup was delicious.   My gyro left a lot to be desired. If you're used to gyros with tzatziki sauce, prepare for disappointment. The pita was fairly large, but there wasn't much meat on it. The menu says it comes with tahini sauce, but it was more like a watery mayo without any of the flavor of tahini. It also had pickles which are different on a gyro, but I like pickles, so that was fine. The french fries were the same as frozen fries from a grocery store.  The chicken shawarma included two wraps and regular fries. It was pretty dry according to my friend.   Since all of us are water drinkers, we asked for glasses of water. Impossible to have here. You have to have the bottled water. The menu says it's spring water, but it's cheap purified water.   Service to the table was efficient, but no one checked on us at any time. The owner was friendly as others have mentioned when we went up to order and pay the bill.  Our bill came to $32 and change.

o8ZR8qAy2vwH0Pe_w_aV_w.text: Two words: yummy and authentic. It's a small, family-friendly place. I've never eaten there but there are only about 7 tables. However, the food is fresh  and made to order. Its so good. The hummus is the best I've had in the city.

photos.caption: Photo of La Shish Kabob - Charlotte, NC, United States. Three Cabob Combo
Photo of La Shish Kabob - Charlotte, NC, United States. Stuffed Grape Leaves. Hummus. Falafel.

rs-1EJiArb5q5morN333Kg.text: Atmosphere is very welcoming, food tastes fresh. I played it safe by ordering something I have has before but looking forward to returning and trying a traditional dish!!

photos.caption: Photo of La Shish Kabob - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Philly with Fries
Photo of La Shish Kabob - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lamb Gyro with Fries

u6ZVbAvFxSzWIvHk5t6SBA.text: I've been here couple of times.  They expanded their menu and the place got bigger. The lamb is really good and very consistent.  The personnel and the owner especially is very nice, he will always greet you and will make you feel at home . One of my favorite places for middle eastern food

oSJDHBpILUBhdEJZPZQIWw.text: Newest dining obsession. Everything is amazing. The owner is so sweet and has come out to greet us each time. Falafel = amazing. Baba ghanouj = amazing. Tomato cucumber salad...AMAZING. They do a mixed grill platter that's enough meat and rice and salad to share between two, but I do recommend an extra side order of baba ghanouj because you will regret it if you don't get it. I'm always looking for another excuse to eat there again.

wJ30aWJpDLkWwuGbdFo7tQ.text: This place has now grown a buffett.  it is a little expensive at 15 adult and 9 for childrens but this place still gets 5 stars bc the buffet quality is still the same quality as menu items.  food is fresh and amazing

udp1L7M4TeAyT7v0N3wyrw.text: This place is hopping and the owner handles the lines of people just like a boss! He gets your order and tells you to take a seat... with 100% accuracy (even while talking on the phone) he brings you your food hot and fresh! You can opt for an AYCE buffet or choose from 20 different menu options and bottled beverages. My husband thoroughly enjoyed the Turkish coffee and falafel! He can't wait to go back.. he's been craving it ever since.

Ds7KDL7fBuNlnCRjov_RtA.text: Most favorite Mediterranean place in Charlotte. We drive 20 mins twice a week for their lamb shanks!!!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of La Shish Kabob - Charlotte, NC, United States. We get these lamb shanks with, lettuce salad + okra soup

w-7xKvMPCnnfOmUTyMga9A.text: We came here as a party of 10 after our families decided to meet up in the area.  I read so many good things about this place. The place is small but, even late at night, there was pretty good business.  The owner looked straight out of The Hobbit trilogies and wasn't super warm and fuzzy.    I think this place was too hyped up in my head after reading the glowing reviews. We had taken our food back to the hotel and unfortunately, the food did not live up to the hype.  I don't think anyone finished their meal.  I love me some spices but the entire meal was entirely too overly spiced.  It might have been due to the meat tasting a bit off...so maybe the heavy hand in spices was to offset that taste/fact?  I was especially excited about kibbeh being on the menu but instantly disappointed when I popped in the first bite.  Too bad I ordered a bunch of everyone.  We are huge fans of kafta but we could barely finish ours.  The kids even quit early and they loooooiiove kafta/kufta/kubideh.  Overall, the portions were decent and the food ok if I hadn't had anything to compare it to.  Maybe this was just an off night since I'm sure the reviews are glowing for a reason.

TIflSXQWuIU9-LqY33Gpzw.text: Got there at 10:45 they watch me and my brother look at the menu and all only to tell us 10 minutes later that they are closed, thought they were opened to midnight ? some other guys looked and giggled . . . The worst. Dont even try that crap anymore

rOrPtZz-KX9mPVqJIId3Zw.text: This food is amazing better than fine dining restaraunts that I've been to. Best lamb sharks I've ever had!

photos.caption: Photo of La Shish Kabob - Charlotte, NC, United States

5gh_jSDd7-4gckGiZpjd5Q.text: First of all, amazing service. I mean AMAZING. The owner is literally always there, checking up on you, making sure you are enjoying everything. Second of all, the food. The lamb shanks are fall of the bone tender, the half chicken is always juicy and flavorful, the gyros are simply perfection. I love this place with all of my food loving soul. Of all the places I eat in this city, La Shish Kabob is my favorite. It's a little fun hole in the wall, with out of this world food and service. Food from the holy land is what the owner tells me, all I can say is keep doing what you are doing sir, and you forever have a happy customer in me.

EdECTnyA9xvBo25DDcSnyQ.text: Just ordered via PostMates...... who makes Chicken Shwarma without the pickle??? And,..... no marinara sauce included with my Mozzarella Sticks!? 3 stars only because the portion sizes were immense! Fries, as a side order to Mozzarella sticks??? Not rushing to order from here again...

m2rY4Iq6E1wZUZuGJ4-4cw.text: My tastebuds will never be the same! For appetizer we had the combo appetizer (you pick 3) with hummus, grape leaves and kibbeh. Oh my word y'all. The hummus was so creamy and rich, grape leaves were fantastic, but seriously, the kibbeh- I can't put it into words how amazing this fried little meat wad is! Haha. Next was entrees.. Lamb shanks were falling off the bone and cooked PERFECTLY. The marbling was to die for and the meat was so juicy. The lamb kabob is cooked differently but equally as awesome. Finally we ended with desert- baklava, the owner said he had just made it that morning. I almost broke up with my boyfriend over the last piece- flaky, light, cream filled center, and not too sweet which is so rare to find in a desert! It was phenomenal!  Thank you La Shish for a wonderful, quick, and affordable dinner!

3mrLEnoKxn2ukedv2PyHjw.text: Excellent customer service,food and prices! My favorite is the lamb gyro! I would definitely recommend it to anyone in the Charlotte area!

6vt61IVIO6jUjxpfG2u_nw.text: The first time coming here with my parents for a dinner, they arrived first and they thought this wasn't even a restaurant. Walking in, it seemed as if it was a small shop, a grocery store even. Instead they had tables and a kitchen with pictures of food and the tv channel set on a foreign news channel.   The first thought came to me as: 'Hm. This should be an interesting experience.' As the manager, or owner, came out he was very nice. He showed us the specials for the day as well as gave us menus. And the menu items, well lets just say it was pretty cheap. When the food came out (I bought a rotisserie chicken) the portions were plentiful. The rice wasn't the usual rice I usually eat, but it was mixed with spices and a little dry (that's the way the rice is supposed to be cooked) and it tasted awesome.  We also ordered the lintel soup, which was also good. At the price, no wonder why people love this place. There wasn't a ton of options on the menu, but as people say "quality, not quantity" this place really defines it. However the quantity of the food that comes out on the main dish is plentiful.  However, there are some things to keep in mind when you come here to eat. They don't have 'free' water when you eat there. It isn't a bad thing, but when the prices are that low, it's understandable. And also, this place is definitely a take-out restaurant. Call in, take an order (or go there and make an order) and enjoy at work or wherever the day takes you.   Overall though, I couldn't decide to give it a 4 or 5. I want to give it a 5, but I think I'll have to come here several more times to get me to scaled to that level. Next time I come though, I'll definitely bring my own water!

photos.caption: Photo of La Shish Kabob - Charlotte, NC, United States. Rotisserie Chicken

pKUFK2ZJJh97W8tR2qw_dw.text: Okay this is going to be not so glowing review for their cheeseburger. $5.99 for a cheeseburger and small side of fries is a little pricey but the meat is halal so thats forgivable. However- the hamburger could be greatly improved. the only thing that got attention on this hamburger is the meat- assumably thawed and microwaved? There was no char on my meat. Other than that, everything else was just plopped on- some lettuce, pickles, tomato, and a cold bun. The saving grace was the ketchup and white sauce that was already squirted on my burger.  I think they could make the hamburger better by caramelizing the onions and toasting up the bun.  Otherwise, they just want you to be happy that you at least get a halal hamburger and be satisfied with that. I wont be coming back for this hamburger. But i will be back for their authentic dishes.

zb5VQZtgSUgad5x_PoSgyg.text: This place is so great I have it on speed dial! My go to is the chicken kabobs with rice and salad.

BZCTbw6MOp-oxDErjksrKQ.text: Ridiculously nice & welcoming staff, great food and inexpensive. Most ethnic eateries aren't as welcoming if you aren't from the country or don't speak the language, this guy calls everyone "Friend". I got the chicken shawarma, baklava, and falafel wrap. I will return!

BnubSHs73pJ7QhjiZzMsAQ.text: great and fresh food.  the prices are ok not that sheap.

EVD8D0lFmDwDTcf_kIkCXA.text: It's been several months since I've stopped by because while the food is usually excellent, one of the cooks actually took my order and bagged my food. What a let down. I paid $10 for an appetizer falafel and a side of tabouli. The tabouli side is supposed to come with a pita which was absent from the bag as well as no fork or spoon to eat it with. It's probably better to eat in as I have gotten excellent service from who I assume is the owner. Since I live across from the airport, I probably won't go out of my way.

z7whkBDH7sXl-YFw_dx_rA.text: Can't believe this place doesn't have more reviews. We tried  the falafal wrap, chicken shawarma and the kafta kabob wrap. All three were excellent and exactly what we were hoping for. The kafta is a must try in my opinion and the owner was so nice!

fDMhKcRty-fVSdI72JCGTg.text: We have been eating here at least a couple times a month since moving to Charlotte and I've never had a bad meal. The lamb shank is great and the lentil soup is amazing. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone who likes food.

L3yjo7iSJ9HjTjv6Wv90UQ.text: Great food!! We go here at least once a month.  Definitely get the lamb shank - enough to feed 2 people.  And the price is as good as it gets!

cJqFmPIcpp6hMu5TkCeKWg.text: Not sure how this place is getting the reviews it does. We lived in Los Angeles for seven years and ate all kinds of Middle Eastern food all over the city. This place is terrible. We got a few apps- the falafel and the kibbeh were the only things decent (oh and the cuc, tomato stuff they gave you when you sat down). The Baba had no flavor, the kibbeh had a weird, not good, taste and the meat pies were disgusting. We also got the chicken schwarma wrap. The chicken was old and hard- the worst pieces of meat were put in it. When the guy asked us if we wanted to take home the almost whole wrap we were leaving behind, and we said no, he didn't ask why. The kafta (kofta) was eh. Not very flavorful and it was flat. It's supposed to be log or cigar shaped- helps it be juicier, not to mention it's more meat. And the atmosphere/facilities are as bad as many ppl said but it also felt dirty. And I won't even say how scary it was to see the cook place vegetables on the grill right next to the raw meat. It might have helped if the veggies came out hot and cooked but they were cold with practically no sear. Nasty.

I5Ive0DqPCQH67wbRET7cA.text: This place is the best in town, I went their last week to get lunch and It was great. the Shawerma meal tastes so god with the garlic sauce I loved it. they were pretty busy since I came around iftar time in Ramadan. the gentleman behind the counter was super freindly I think his name was Ibrahim, he offered me Baklawa while waiting for my ordered. I love this place and I will return soon, I recommened it to all food lovers!!

XAJxsI_bmU_B0hrkJ2H0kA.text: Why didn't I discover this place sooner? You wouldn't know by the looks of the restaurant, but this place serves some of the best Mediterranean food you can find this side of the Atlantic! Not only is the food amazing, but the prices are super reasonable and really let you feel like you can try a bunch of new food without spending a ton of money! The lentil soup is some of the best soup I've ever had, though it is a bit on the spicy side! I also highly recommend the Lamb Philly Cheesesteak as a new spin on an American classic. Do yourself a favor and try this place out!

Gmb3AAjce5hpU5O50Jl16A.text: I've been a long time lurker on yelp but never written a review before, but La Shish Kabob is so good it would be a crime not to. This place was incredible ! I have never eaten a chicken shawarma before, but I'm pretty sure it was the tastiest meal I've ever had. The rotisserie chicken inside was flawless ! it comes in a wrap that looks like a soft-shell tortilla but the taste and texture of it are much better. I also tried falafel for the first time and it was great as well. It reminded me of the tasty fried chick-pea stuff you find at Indian buffets, but falafel blows the similar Indian dish out of the water ! I washed it all down with a Lebanese kiwi-flavored soft-drink that was so good I considered buying about 5 of them when I left to keep around the apartment. How other people rated this place less than 5 stars baffles me, I'd give it 6 stars if I could ! I'm definitely coming back in the near future.

oXxTITwLmwhYjDfoUkQo2g.text: Calling all Muslims and Jews!  Peace in the Middle East (or Middle Earth, as Bruno calls it) is possible through food.  We saw all types of people eating here when we had dinner.  The owner and chef looks like that dude from Survivor a few years ago, with the tie-dye shirt and curly hair.  And wow, does he make a mean kabob.  Their signature dish appears to be the kabob platter with three kabobs and kafta.  The kafta was served over a bed of delicious brown rice and with a grilled tomato that oozed with flavor.  Heavens to Betsy, it was good.  The apple of my eye (the wife) had the lamb special and she said its authenticity almost did her in.  The lamb was tender with a yoghurt sauce and nuts.  Lots of great food and very reasonably priced.  If you go, pick up a CD of Arabic Groove, roll down the windows of the car and blast it as you approach this small gem of a restaurant on the east side (yes, the east side, say it proud, say it loud) of Charlotte.

PZ4s5SCbdcW7Y6kUbOUYHQ.text: This is some of the BEST food you will EVER taste.  The SERVICE IS EXCELLENT!!! No need to run down the list of their dishes I have had everything and its all done to PERFECTION!! From the prices to the portions this guy KNOWS how to treat a customer!

hUjBMj7pB_OsBql30kn_kA.text: The best food mediterranean food in Charlotte.  The shawarma is amazing, the hummus is rich and delicious, and the falafel is incredible and perfectly fried.  It is beyond fantastic with a wonderful owner and food that is authentic, reasonably priced, and you should go out of your way to eat hear as you will not be dissapointed!

TE4EFkFjBWdm6yAwJio-Tg.text: The food is sooo good with generous servings. Favorite: grilled chicken with special rice, very flavorful, fresh (no meat freezing from my understanding, that's why it tastes sooo good) Service is great, very friendly. I don't usually write reviews but I have to give props to this diamond in the ruff.

xRIdQMzTlhj0_A5ZrrE3wA.text: Have tried other expensive kabob places in Charlotte and this one is as good, if not better.  Stopped in for lunch for a chicken kabob wrap and a side of tabouli.  Both were excellent  and the place was busy at lunch.  New favorite spot!

TT5xIMxSKJWq4cryuPos2A.text: freaking amazing the price of the lamb shanks is INSANE and they give you so much food !  you must go here!

efuQC4sVAZccukY9EP8uig.text: great food first time I try Shawarma but it was good

k0Ag6BypZPX2Ir_11Dyf6g.text: Absolutely marvelous!!!  My husband & I had passed by several times and said we needed to try it as our favorite Middle Eastern restaurant closed several months ago.  As mentioned in other reviews, it is a very small restaurant and the ambience is non-existent but this is not even noticeable because of the friendliness of the people and the quality of the food.  We got the appetizer combo and chose houmos, falafel and stuffed grape leaves.  We also got the kabob combo which came with two sides; we chose a wonderful salad and fries - the fries were average but with the amount of food, it didn't matter.  We also sampled the rice which is another choice of sides - not special but good.  The food is very, very reasonable and we will defintely be back.  We decided that besides the houmos (the best I've ever had), our favorites were the falafel and the chicken kabob.  This place is hidden in a nondescript strip mall. I hope it survives.
